In 1982 he got married. He lives in his own home. He has worked as a soldier since 1977 from the hours of 7:30am to 3:30pm. He has a salary of 11,330MT and does not save any money.

This is his third loan through Hluvuku, and he had a loan with the International Bank of Mozambique for 31,000MT. All of the loans were applied to purchasing construction materials. Fernando came to know Hluvuku through colleagues that were already clients, and he selected it because of the advantages offered. He has a dream to own his own car with the help from loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Fernando António B. tem 48 anos de idade e natural da provincial de gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades entre 28, 26, dois gêmios com 19 anos e ultimo com 9 anos respectivamente, uma está no lar, tres ainda estudantes e uma trabalha na RSA. Fernando estudou até Nona classe, parou por serviço militar obrigatório que lhe fez viajar muito. Viveu com os pais até aos 16 anos de idade e dai mudou se para maputo quando conclui a Quarta classe, e veio continuar em Maputo até Nona classe e mais tarde ingressou nos S.M.O e em 1982 casou-se. Vive numa casa própria. Trabalha como militar desde 1977, o seu horário é das 7:30 às 15:30h, tem um salário de 11.330,00mt e não consegue poupar. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e teve um empréstimo no BIM (banco internacional de Moçambique) no valor de 31.000,00mt e todos os emprestimos foram aplicados na compra de material de construção. E conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que já eram clientes, tendo optado por esta esta IMF pelas vantagens oferecidas. Tem como sonho é ter seu próprio carro e isso conta com ajuda de empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Petty Traders Group

texts.en:
Jariatu K., Aiafu K., and Isatu S. named their group Petty Traders. They want a loan of Le 1,500,000.

Jariatu, the leader of this group, was born in Sanda about 30 miles from Makeni. She now lives with her husband here in Makeni where she also does her business. She is 32 and has 4 children. She sells slippers and has been in this business for the past 10 years now. Previous loans have helped Jariatu a lot. They have helped her business grow. She was able to pay her children's school fees and also handles most of her numerous problems. With a new loan Jariatu's stock of slippers will increase from 6 cartons to 12 cartons.

Aiafu also sells slippers. Previous loans have now helped him get a total of 4 cartons of slippers. He use to have only 2 cartons. With a new loan, he is expecting to get 6 cartons. Isatu sells items like gums, biscuits, batteries, mints, lollipops, etc. She thanks God for the previous loans she got from Kiva. Such loans have helped her business grow, and out of the proceeds she is able to make a livelihood.

loans.use: Buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Since a young age Rosana had a special talent for making clothes, and therefore, she is an excellent seamstress. In order to execute her job, Rosana uses sewing machines, machines to mend, and other type of textile machines. On an every day basis she makes garments which she sells for cash or credit. At 39, Rosana is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them are already independent, but the youngest still receives help from her parents so she can finish her studies and have family. Rosana next to her husband, who works in the transportation industry are dedicated to meet all of their daughters’ needs. Rosana would like to open her own clothing store, but for the time being, she wants to build a small workshop to make clothes, this is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Desde muy joven se inclinó por el arte textil, por eso, ahora Rosana es una excelente costurera, cuenta con máquinas de coser, máquinas remalladoras, y máquinas recubridoras, que utiliza para la realización de su trabajo, diariamente confecciona ropa para todos los gustos, la que vende al contado o al crédito.A sus 39 años, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos ya independientes, quedando la última, a la que quiere darle lo necesario para que termine sus estudios y forme su propia familia, junto a sus esposo, que se dedica al transporte le han brindado a sus hijas todo lo necesario hasta hoy.Rosana quiere tener su propia tienda de ropa, pero por el momento quiere mandar a construir un pequeño local para su taller, por ello es que solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: To build a small workshop to make clothes

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
Catarina C. is 46 years old and a native of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is single and the mother of a 29 year-old son who is already married. She lives with 2 nieces and 2 grandchildren.

Catarina attended school until the 4th grade and stopped because she was pregnant. She grew up with her mother who was separated when she was a baby. She got pregnant when she was 16 which obliged her to quit school. The father of her son refused to assume responsibility so Catarina had to arrange for another husband. With their first child something went wrong, and since she was unable to have more children she was rejected for the second time. She decided to return to her mother's house and never married again.

She started an business to sell various products and gradually was able to build a home. Catarina has lived for 6 years raising chickens. She works alone, learned from a friend and has 6 years of experience. She has an average monthly production of 300 chickens which equates to about 3,000MT per month.

This is the second loan with Hluvuku and she had one with the Tchuma cooperative. The first loan with Hluvuku was for 10,200MT and the second will be for 16,000MT. All proceeds are for raising chickens. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who was already a client. Catarina is confident that with this loan she will be able to increase her production, respond to her clientele, and consequently realize better profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Catarina C. tem 46 anos de idade e natural da provincial do Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mae um filho de 29 anos e já se casou. Vive com duas sobrinhas e dois netos. Catarina estudou até Quarta classe e parou por ter ficada gravida. Cresceu junto da mãe esta que separou-se quando ela era bebe. Ficou gravida aos 16 anos de idade situação que lhe obrigou a deixar de estudar e o pai do filho que veio ater negou de assumir e teve que arrumar outro marido e no primeiro filho algo não foi bem durante ao parte fez com ela não pudesse dar mais filhos e assim foi rejeitada pela segunda vez e decide voltar a casa da mae e nunca se casou mais e optou por criar um auto emprego de venda de produtos diversos e aos poucos construiu sua casa. Catarina vive a 6 anos na base de criação de frangos e trabalha sozinha, aprendeu a traves de uma amiga e tem uma experiência de 6 anos. Tem uma produção media mensal de 300 frangos o que aproxima a 3000,00mt liquido mensal. Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e um na Cooperativa Tchuma , o primeiro na Hluvuku foi de 10200,00mt e o segundo sera de 16000,00mt todos destinados para criação dos frangos e conheceu a Hluvuku a traves de uma amiga que já era cliente. Catarina está confiante que com este empréstimo vai aumentar a sua produção assim responderá a sua clientela e consequêntimente verá da melhor maneira os lucros.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: José Benvindo

texts.pt:
José Benvindo C. was born in Maputo. He is 45 years old and married. He went to school through the 10th grade and had to interrupt his studies to fulfill his obligatory military service. He has 4 children. The oldest is 22 years old and is in the 10th grade. The youngest is 3 years old.

He grew up in a family environment with his parents, however his father passed away when he was 9 years old and his oldest sister ended up caring for him. In 1978 he was solicited to fulfill his military service in the Beira Province of Sofala in the center of the country.

In 1984 for his abilities in dealing with people he received a scholarship and entered the Beira institute of health sciences where he studied nursing. Years later he was transferred to Maputo to command in the Navy. In 1988 he was discharged and began working in the Hospital of Catembe as a nurse. He has worked as a supervisor in the areas of Tuberculosis and leprosy for 20 years which has given him great experience.

He has a monthly income of 3,285MT but is unable to save any money. This is his first loan through Hluvuku which he discovered through some coleagues. He has a dream to one day raise hogs.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

José Benvindo C. nasceu em Maputo, casado maritalmente, tem 45 anos de idade, estudou até 10ªclasse e teve que interromper os estudos para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Tem 4 filhos o mais velho tem 22 anos estuda na 10ªclasse e o mais novo tem 3 anos. Cresceu e viveu num ambiente famíliar com os pais, contudo o pai faleceu quando tinha 9 anos e quem passou a tomar conta dele foi a irmã mais velha. Em 1978 foi solicitado para cumprir o serviço militar na Beira Província de Sofala no Centro do Pais e em 1984 por suas capacidades em lidar com as pessoas teve bolsa de estudos onde ingresso no instituto de ciencias de saude da Beira onde cursou enfermagem e anos mais tarde foi transferido para o comando da Marinha de guerra em maputo. Em 1988 foi desmobilizado do exercito e passou a trabalhar no Hospital da Catembe como enfermeiro. É funcionario efectivo na area de supervisão da Tuberculese e lepra a mais de 20 anos. Facto que lhe assegura maior experiencia . Tem um rendimento mensal de 3.285,00mt e nao consegue poupar nenhum, este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e tomou conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku atraves de colegas. Tem como sonho começar com a criação de suinos.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Jade

texts.es:
Jade is 26 years old and has 3 young children. Along with her husband they manage a glassware store. Her husband is a glassmaker teacher and she takes care of the customers, together they make a great team. In addition, Jade sells food at night, since extra income is always welcome. In order to expand their glassware business they require a loan, which they promise to pay back punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Jade tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, que aún son menores de edad. Junto con su esposo administran una vidriería, él es maestro vidriero y ella se encarga de atender a los clientes, hacen un gran equipo. Adicionalmente, Jade por las noches vende comida, ya que un ingreso extra siempre es necesario, nos dice.Para ampliar su vidriería requieren de una cantidad de dinero, dinero que piden por este medio, en calidad de préstamo, con la promesa de ser puntuales en los pagos.

loans.use: To expand their glassware business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sara Joana

texts.pt:
Sara Joana G. is 26 years old and a native of Maputo. She is single without children and a college student. She has worked for the Ministry of Agriculture for 5 years in an administrative function from 7:30am until 3:30pm. She has a monthly salary of 3,100MT and is able to save some money each month.

She lives in her parents' home. Since she was little she has lived with her parents. She started school when she was 5 and is currently attending college. In 2003 she started working for the ministry as her first job.

This is the first loan through Hluvuku and she has never had any other. She came to know Hluvuku through her aunt who is already a client. Sara's big dream is to build a home and furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Sara Joana G. tem 26 anos de idade e é natural de Maputo, solteira ainda não tem filhos é estudante no ensino superior. É funcionaria do ministerio da Agricultura a 5 anos, como administrativa e tem um horário das 7:30 às 15:30h. Tem um salário mensal de 3.100,00mt e consegue poupar algum dinheiro mensalmente. Vive na casa dos pais. Desde pequena vive com os seus pais começou a estudar aos 5 anos e neste momento frequenta o ensino superior em 2003 começa a trabalhar no ministério como seu primeiro emprego. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve noutros bancos e conheceu a Hluvuku a traves da sua tia que já era cliente. Constitui como grande sonho para Senhora Sara construir sua casa e mobilar.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 38 years old and is the mother of 4 four children, who are her reason to continue to advance in life. Rosa cultivates camu camu (citrus fruit native of her region), and she has also a small mom and pop shop at her house. Her husband Constantino, supports Rosa on all of her goals and aspirations, he already retired. Rose’s desire is to increase the quantity of seeds of camu camu, and in the future export these products rich in vitamin C. In order to accomplish this she needs a capital investment that will help her make her dreams come true. Let’s support this mother of four, who with effort and earnestness continues to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa tiene 38 años y es madre de 4 cuatro niños, quienes son su razón de seguir adelante, se dedica al cultivo de camu camu (fruto cítrico nativo de su región), adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega de abarrotes en su casa, su esposo Constantino, la apoya en todas sus aspiraciones, él ya se jubiló y es pensionista. El deseo de Rosa es incrementar la cantidad de semillas de camu camu, y en un futuro cercano, exportar estos productos tan ricos en vitamina C, para eso, necesita de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante y ver crecer lo que desea. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y ahínco sigue trabajando duro.

loans.use: To purchase camu camu seeds in order to increase production.

loans.name: Rokamdin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rokamdin, which means in Temne: "we are all members of the same family." Its members include Isatu K., Pa Molai S. and Sema S.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,100,000.

Their leader is Isatu K.. She is 41. She was born in Gbengbedu N'guwawu, one of the surrounding villages of Makeni. She is married with 7 children. Isatu sells condiments at the Makeni town main lorry park. She now has more than 10 years of experience in the business. She has repaid her previous loan successfully. She is now asking for a new loan. With a new loan, she is expecting to increase the quantity of items in her stall.

loans.use: Expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aureline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aureline M. was born on 1 February 1969 in Bymba in Rwanda, a country in central Africa. She has been married to a Togolese man since 1998 and has one child. She is a seamstress and has set up shop in Agoè in Lomé since 2004. She runs her business at home and primarily oversews clothing for her customers. Currently, she has many clients, and is unable to satisfy their demands quickly. The first loan she obtained allowed her to obtain her first oversewing machine.

She is asking for this second loan to buy a second oversewing machine and several haberdashery items such as thread and poplin in order to better serve her customers and make a profit.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame M. Aureline est née le 1er février 1969 à Bymba au Rwanda, pays situé dans l’Afrique de centrale. Elle s’est mariée à un togolais depuis 1998 et à un enfant. Elle est couturière et s’est installée à Agoè à Lomé depuis 2004. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile et fait surtout du surfilage des habits pour ses clients. Actuellement elle reçoit beaucoup de clients et n’arrive à vite les satisfaire. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’avoir une première machine à surfilage.

Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter une deuxième machine à surfilage et quelques articles de mercerie tels que le fil à coudre et les popelines afin de mieux servir ses clients et tirer de bénéfice.

loans.use: To buy an oversewing machine and various haberdashery supplies

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena makes her living by selling cold beverages and providing good customer service to her clients. Her business is located in a commercial area close to her home. She feels happy to be in that place, since there is a lot of people passing by all day long, which is good for her business. Milena is 52 years olds and she has 6 children, 4 of them independent and with their own family, the other two are studying. Her husband William, sales different types of merchandise and it was him who encouraged Milena to start the business. The most important thing is to continue to grow the business, and in the near future they would like to renovate and expand the premises in order to offer a better atmosphere to clients. This is why Milena is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de bebidas heladas y una buena atención es el diario vivir de Milena, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un lugar comercial dentro de su zona. Ella se siente feliz de estar en ese lugar, ya que concurre mucha gente de varios lugares. Milena a sus 52 años tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos independientes y con familia propia, los 2 últimos están estudiando, su esposo William, se dedica a la venta de diferentes mercaderías y fue quién incentivó a Milena en su negocio. Lo más importante es seguir creciendo y más adelante hacer algunas modificaciones y ampliar su local para tener mayor acogida, sin embargo, para ello requiere del dinero que aquí pide en calidad de préstamo para realizar su deseo.

loans.use: To improve and expand their business

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two grown children. She sells women's clothing in a market in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Alla launched her business on advice of her relative who is an entrepreneur, too. She set reasonable pricing policy and it became one of the reasons why many clients come to her for clothing. Alla has been in this business for 10 years. She already has about $2000 in inventory and owns a vehicle which makes her business a lot more mobile.

She is hoping to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing, e.g. sweaters, for the upcoming chilly fall season. Alla is very sharp and manages her time very efficiently. We believe her determination and focused attitude will secure prompt loan repayment and further success of her trade. Moreover, we are hoping increased sales will help Alla generate additional income and make some savings for a much desired vacation in Egypt.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase 60 sweaters for fall season

loans.name: Aniko

texts.en:
Aniko is a private entrepreneur from town of Beregovo. She runs a small business selling children's clothing and footwear in the local marketplace, called "Progress". Assorted inventory she has for sale in her kiosk is very high quality. Aniko has been in business for 7 years. Presently, her gross income is about $600. She has over $3000 invested in merchandise.

Aniko is very determined and hard-working. She seeks to reach absolute sustainability in business. One of her biggest goals is expansion of her trade and higher income. Aniko has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. We believe all this will help her reach success and repay the loan without any delinquencies.

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single. She runs a small business selling souvenirs and small necessities in the central market in Beregovo, Ukraine. Tatyana has been in business for 15 years. Currently she has about $8000 in inventory each month and her monthly gross income amounts to $1400.

Tatyana works in a favorable location which adds a lot to the success of her business. She has an enterprising spirit. She is very hard-working and persistant. The success Tatyana has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work. She has repaid each of her loans from "Nadiya Ukraine" without any delinquencies. Tatyana would like to get a loan for 1500 Grivnas to increase her assortment of items for sale so she can better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. She always tries to offer a nice variety of merchandise and avoids copying the products of other markets vendors. Tatyana has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita has been selling food during the evenings for quite a while now. She sees herself as a multi-talented woman; during the mornings she works in a construction project. Her food business is located in a highly transited place. Lita is 45 years old and has three children that work to pay their technical studies. What is important is to come through, not stay back. She wants to expand her business because she has had a good response due to her good flavors and joy. Her clients are very happy in her business which is why she wants to have a kiosk build for better comfort. She hereby presents this loan petition.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Lita vende comiD. por las noches desde hace tiempo atrás, es una mujer que se considera polifacética, ya que por la mañana también trabaja en un proyecto de construcción. Su negocio de comiD. se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy transitable. Lita tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos, los que trabajan para pagar sus estudios técnicos. Lo importante es salir adelante, no quedarse atrás, quiere incrementar y ampliar su negocio, ya que tiene muy buena acogiD. debido a su buena sazón y jovialidad. Los clientes se sienten muy complacidos en su negocio, para ello quiere mandar a construir su kiosco para una mejor comodidad, motivo por el que se presenta en este medio con su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To build a kiosk in order to provide better services and comfort to her clients.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Koteka

texts.fr:
Born on 8 December 1971 in Lomé, Miss Koteka M. is an unmarried woman with two children and lives in the Agoè district. Her main business is the sale of primary need goods. She began this business in 1997 and has already benefited once from a loan through WAGES, and repaid it without incident.

She is asking for this second loan to replenish her stock, which is almost exhausted; she would like to buy 12 bags of rice and 10 boxes of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 8 décembre 1971 à Lomé demoiselle M. Koteka est une femme célibataire avec deux enfants qui réside dans le quartier d’Agoè. Son activité principale est la vente des produits de premières nécessités. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis 1997 et a une fois bénéficié un crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé.

Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour refaire son stock qui est presque épuisé et désire acheter 12 sacs de riz et 10 cartons de tomates.

loans.use: To buy primary need goods

loans.name: Somialo

texts.fr:
Currently married, Mrs. Somialo T. was born on 18 January 1971 in Notsè in the Prefecture of Haho, 100 km from the city of Lomé. Her husband being away, she has to take care of her needs by herself. She is a retailer of pagne cloth (a highly valued printed cloth) in the Kégué area. Sometimes she travels from place to place to sell her goods, and covers several kilometres a day. She has benefited from one previous loan, which she repaid without incident.

This second loan she is asking for will allow her to buy 27 rolls of Hitarget-type pagne cloth and 20 rolls of WAX-type pagne cloth in order to replenish her stock and sell better.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée, madame T. Somialo est née le 18 janvier 1975 est née à Notsè dans la préfecture de Haho à 100Km de la ville de Lomé. Son mari étant en voyage, elle assure elle-même ses besoins. Elle est revendeuse de pagne dans le quartier Kégué. Parfois elle vend de quartier en quartier et parcourt plusieurs kilomètres par jour. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.

Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 27 pièces de pagne de type Hitarget et 20 pièces de pagne de type WAX afin de refaire son stock et de mieux vendre.

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth (brightly printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor is a man who married when he was very young, and he has two children. His wife helps him sell cosmetics. He learned to be an electrician at a young age and, ten years ago, he and his brother started a business, which allows Victor to give a better quality of life to his son, who will be born soon.

Victor needs a loan for US $500 that he will repay in 6 months so that he can buy a polishing machine, a new drill, and a chopsaw. With your help, Victor will go forward.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor es un hombre que se caso muy joven tiene 2 niños, su esposa le ayuda vendiendo cosméticos, el aprendió el ofició de electricista desde pequeño, inicio su negocio hace 10 años junto con su hermano ya que el desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo que esta próximo a nacer.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una pulidora, taladro nuevo y caladora. Con tu ayuda Víctor saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy tools for his work

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58720

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.es:
Carmen became a mother 6 months ago, and her husband is a laborer. Their in-laws help them out, and they live in her parents’ home. She started her business a year ago, selling cosmetics and skin care products. She took a course in facials and started to gain customers. The only thing she desires is to be able to give her son a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $450.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase work supplies and to be able to provide other services, such as in-home massages, thus being able to increase her profits because she would like to have her own spa in the future. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es mama desde hace 6 meses su esposo es obrero, los apoyan sus suegros y viven en la casa de los papas de ella. Ella inicio su negocio hace un año cuando empezó a vender cosméticos y productos para el cuidado de la piel, tomo un curso de faciales y ya empezó a tener clientes. Ella lo único que desea es poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo y poder ofrecer otros servicios como masajes a domicilio y así poder incrementar sus ganancias, ya que en un futuro desea tener su spa. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase work supplies

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaya M. was born on September 16, 1979 in the far north of Togo in the village of Kantindi. He is married and the father of two children. He is a refrigerator mechanic by trade and sells freezers and fixes fridge/freezer coils in Lomé's Agoè neighborhood. He set up his own store and workshop, “Strefi,” in 2004 and manages it with a great deal of professionalism. He is requesting this first-time loan to purchase 6 medium-sized refrigerators in the port of Lomé so that he can sell them and make a good amount of profit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur M. Yaya est né le 16 septembre 1979 à l’extrême nord du Togo dans le village de Kantindi. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il est frigoriste de profession et fait le rebobinage et la vente des congélateurs dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il a crée son atelier de vente « STREFI » depuis 2004 et le gère avec beaucoup de professionnalisme. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter six (6) frigos de taille moyenne au port de Lomé afin de pouvoir vendre et de tirer beaucoup de bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerators

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Born on June 28, 1973 in Lomé, Mr. Yaovi K. is married with one child. He sells school supplies in Lomé's Agoè neighborhood. He began this business in 1998 and has mastered all the ins and outs. He has on his shelves books, exercise books and other printed material. He is requesting this first-time loan in order to purchase a case of books and 5 cases of 100-page exercise books so that he can sell them when the new school term begins.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 28 juin 1973 à Lomé, monsieur K. Yaovi est marié et père d’un enfant. Il est revendeur d’articles scalaires dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et maîtrise les contours de celle-ci. Il dispose alors sur son étalage des livres, des cahiers et autres documents. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter un carton de livre et 5 cartons de cahiers de 100 pages afin de pouvoir les vendre à la rentrée scolaire

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Domiga Leonor

texts.es:
Dominga and Antonio are the parents of three boys, who in these days are attending college which requires various expenses. Antonio, despite of his advanced age, works efficiently in a mine outsiD. the city of Juliaca. Dominga, on the other hand, with the support of their children, rents tricycles to proviD. urban transportation locally, and also sells beverages and beer during the different events in her community. These activities allow them to obtain additional indispensable income. Dominga’s desire is to rely on a loan that will be completely invested in her business. This diligent and responsible woman promises to be punctual and responsible in its reimbursement.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Dominga y Antonio son padres D. 3 muchachos, quienes, en estos momentos están cursando estudios superiores y estos requieren D. varios gastos. Antonio, pese a su avanzada edad, se desenvuelve eficientemente como obrero en una mina en las afueras D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, en tanto, Dominga, con apoyo D. sus hijos, alquila triciclos para brindar transporte urbano en su localidad, adicionalmente, venD. bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, durante los diferentes eventos D. su localidad, actividad mediante la cual logran obtener adicionales, pero indispensable ingresos económicos. El deseo D. Dominga es contar con un préstamo que será invertido completamente en su negocio, esta diligente y responsable mujer promete ser puntual y responsable en el reembolso.

loans.use: To invest in her business of tricylce rentals and beverage sales .

loans.name: Halissatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Halissatou I. E. D. was born on October 13, 1964 in Bafilo in the Assoli prefecture in northern Togo. She is married and has three children. She is a seamstress and also sells handbags and shoes in Lomé’s Agoè Cacavéli neighborhood. She has previously received a loan and repaid it in full. She is requesting a second loan in order to buy an embroidery machine, 40 handbags and 25 pairs of shoes. This will enable her to increase her stock levels and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame I. E. D. Halissatou est née le 13 octobre 1964 à Bafilo dans la préfecture d’Assoli au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et a trois enfants. Elle est couturière et fait également le commerce de sacs de sortie et de chaussure dans le quartier d’Agoè Cacavéli à Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter une machine de broderie, 40 sacs de sortie et 25 paires de chaussures. Ceci lui permettra de réhausser le niveau de son stock et de mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use: To buy handbags and shoes

loans.name: Rosa Leonor

texts.es:
Rosita, as her neighbors and clients call her lovingly, is a caring, and responsible mother completely dedicated to her family. Ever since she became married, she decided she would abandon her native town of Yunguyo and look for better job opportunities. It is so that she now lives in the city of Juliaca, and is satisfied by counting on the unconditional support of her husband and their two children, who give her the strength needed to continue her business. She sells a variety of socks; merchandise which she obtains in the city of Desaguadero, and then sells in the cities of Cuzco and Arequipa. Her husband works providing transportation to those cities. Rosita’s dream is to increase her merchandise, and not only sell socks, but undergarments for women, men, and children. She is sure that with your support and this investment she will be able to better her business.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita, como cariñosamente la llaman sus vecinos y clientes, es una madre amorosa, responsable y dedicada a su familia, desde que contrajo matrimonio decidió abandonar su pueblo natal Yunguyo y buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo, es así, que radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, actualmente tiene la satisfacción de contar con el apoyo incondicional de esposo y sus 2 niños, quienes le dan las fuerzas suficientes para continuar con su negocio, ella vende variedad de calcetines, mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Desaguadero y la vende en la ciudades de Cuzco y Arequipa. Su esposo trabaja brindando servicio de transporte departamental a dichas ciudades, el deseo de Rosita es aumentar su mercadería, y no sólo vender calcetines, sino también, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Está segura que con tu apoyo y esta inversión podrá mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To increase merchandise for her clothes sales business.

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who has gone through tough times despite of her young age. When she was a child, she suffered the loss of her father, and shortly after she was separated from her mother due to lack of economical resources. This did not allow her to finish her secondary education (high school). Life granted her the gift of motherhood, but her husband and father of her child abandoned them without any logical explanation and without a financial background to shelter her. Since then she has done different chores to provide for her son. Now she sells socks, "chullos" (Peruvian knit hats with ear flaps), gloves, and other merchandise offered in the travelling business in one of the main streets of the city of Juliaca, always accompanied by her son. The wish that this diligent and young mother cherishes in her heart is to offer her son a better life. She is sure that increasing her merchandise, her business and her income will also increase.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es una mujer que a su corta edad atravesó por momentos muy difíciles, de niña sufrió la penosa perdida de su padre y al poco tiempo tuvo que separase del lado de su madre por falta de recursos económicos, esto no le permitió concluir sus estudios secundarios, la vida le concedió el regalo de ser madre, pero al cabo de poco tiempo, su esposo y padre de su niño la abandonó sin ninguna explicación dejándola sola y sin ningún respaldo económico con que ampararse, desde entonces se dedicó a diferentes oficios con el fin de que su pequeño niño no pase privaciones. Ahora se dedica a la venta de calcetines, chullos, guantes, etc., mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria en una de las principales y concurridas avenidas de al ciudad de Juliaca, siempre acompañada de su hijo. El deseo que cobija en su corazón esta diligente y joven madre es ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su niño y está segura que aumentando su capital de inversión en su negocio logrará mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To increase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es:
Mrs Santos Sabina is 28 years old and is married. She studied until third grade of secondary school and she has 2 young kids who are both in primary school and she lives in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

To help herself financially she started making crafts, doing embroidery, making jewelery and also selling AVON cosmetics. She sells winter clothes (ponchos, coats) in the market in the old railway station. She decided to participate in Manuela Ramos to become independent and to keep being prosperous. The first loan that she received was for $300 which she invested in buying wool, cosmetic products, wallets and ornaments.

She belongs to the group 'Santa Lucia'. With the loan of $700 that she will repay over a period of 4 months she will buy materials, embroidery, ribbon to edge and threads. She would like to keep investing to generate her own income, have some merchandise and invest in her kids' education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Santos Sabina está casada, tiene 28 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria, tiene 02 hijos pequeños, estudiantes del nivel primario, vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó haciendo manualidades, bordados, biyouteria, y a la vez vende productos cosméticos de AVON. Participa en ferias, en la ex estación del ferrocarril vendiendo ropa para el invierno (ponchos, chalinas). Decidió participar en Manuela Ramos para independizarse y seguir prosperando. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, invertido en la compra de lana, productos cosméticos, carteras, adornos. Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “SANTA LUCIA”. Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, piensa invertir en telas, bordados, cintas para bordar, hilos y telas. La empresaria piensa, seguir invirtiendo para generar sus propios ingresos, llegar a tener una mercería e invertir en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy material, tape, thread etc/Compra de telas, cintas, hilos, etc.

loans.name: Maguelewe

texts.fr:
Married to to Mr. Kossi Noulefanski, who is a soldier, Mrs. Maguelew G. was born on February 17, 1983 in Tém’dja in the Ogou prefecture. She has three children and her main business involves selling charcoal and corn in the market in Agoè. She is requesting this first-time loan to purchase 15 bags of charcoal and 2 bags of corn in order to sell more and draw an income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à monsieur NOULEFANSI Kossi qui est un militaire, dame G. Maguelewe est née le 17 février 1983 à Témédja dans la préfecture de l’Ogou. Elle a trois enfants et a pour activité principale la vente de charbon de bois et de maïs dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbon de bois et 2 sacs de maïs afin de mieux vendre et de tirer un revenu.

loans.use: To purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Afi Holali

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Holali A. was born in Kamina, a small village in Togo, on June 20, 1980. She is married and the mother of two children. She currently lives in Lomé and sells health products. Since 2004 she has been involved with the American products GNLD. Seeing the profit in this product range, she stopped selling other products to specialize solely in the sale of GNLD products. In terms of marketing, she already has a clientele whom she supplies from her own home. She also makes sales by walking around, which means the products run out quickly. She would like to have a greater selection of products and for this she needs to increase her capital, hence the request for this first-time loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi Holali est née à Kamina, un petit village du TOGO le 20 juin 1980. Elle est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. Elle vit aujourd’hui à Lomé et revend les produits de santé. Depuis 2004, elle y associa les produits américains GNLD. Voyant la rentabilité de cette gamme de produit, elle abandonna la vente des autres produits et se spécialise uniquement dans la vente des produits GNLD. Pour la commercialisation elle disposait déjà d’une clientèle qui se ravitaille chez elle à la maison. De plus elle est ambulante ce qui fait que ses produits s’écoulent rapidement. Elle voudrait diversifier ses produits et pour cela elle a besoin d’augmenter son capital d’où la demA. de ce premier prêt.

loans.use: To buy GNLD health products

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is 49 years old and is a widow. She studied in primary school and has 2 kids. Her eldest daughter is doing a degree in nursing in the University of Trujillo and her youngest son is in primary school.

She started to sell meat and giblets in her house in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad. She also has a grocery store. Despite the rise in prices she keeps buying merchandise for her business to try and break through the barriers that having a business presents, and thanks to her efforts her family is moving forward. The first loan that she received was of $300 and she invested it in meat, potatoes etc. She belongs to the group 'Virgen de Fatima', and with the loan of $1,200 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will increase her income.

Maria Magdalena dreams of remodeling her house, seeing her kids become professionals and having a mini-mart.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora María Magdalena tiene 49 años, es viuda, estudió Educación Primaria, tiene 02 hijos, su primer hija estudia la carrera de Enfermería en la Universidad Nacional de Trujillo y su hijo menor es estudiante del nivel Primario. La socia empezó a vender carne y menudencia en su casa, en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, adicionalmente tiene una bodega de abarrotes. A pesar del incremento de precios, la socia sigue comprando la mercadería para el negocio, trata de pasar las barreras que se le presentan, gracias a su esfuerzo su familia está saliendo adelante. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, invertido en la compra de carne, papa, etc. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA “. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará carne para incrementar los ingresos. La señora María Magdalena sueña con remodelar su casa, ver a sus hijos profesionales y tener un minimarket.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk/Compra al por mayor de carne.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Graciela Lucina

texts.es:
Graciela Lucina is married and is 40 years old. She studied higher technology and works in the Region teaching the people of La Sierra handicrafts. She has 2 kids who study, she lives in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

On her days off this businesswoman sells cosmetic products of different beauty lines which she sells in craft markets to generate additional income. She received an invitation from a friend who belongs to the group 'Virgen de Fatima', and the first loan that she had with them was of $300 which she invested in buying cosmetic products to increase her stock.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With the loan of $1,300 that she will pay off over a period of 6 months she will buy a photocopier so she will offer a photocopying service too, and this will help her kids and husband. Her dream is to see her kids become professional.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Graciela Lucina está casada, tiene 40 años, estudió Superior Técnica, trabaja en la Región capacitando a los pobladores de la sierra en el curso de manualidades, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria, en sus días libres se dedica a vender productos cosméticos de diferentes líneas de belleza y participa en ferias vendiendo manualidades para poder generar ingresos adicionales. Recibió la invitación de una amiga para pertenecer al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA”, el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00, el cual ha invertido en la compra de productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock. Hace 02 años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará otra fotocopiadora ya que también brinda el servicio de fotocopias actividad en la cual le ayudan sus hijos y esposo. La socia sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier/Compra de fotocopiadora.

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
Mrs. Edelmira Leonor is single mother and is 55 years old. She studied to be a high-level technician, an executive secretariat, and a commercial secretariat. A few years ago, she retired. Edelmira has one daughter, who is independent. She lives in the district of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad.

The businesswomen researched and studied the production of bricks on the internet and from there, she, with the support of her grandchildren, started her business. She has molds and vibrating machines. She takes part in fairs, where she shows her work (the bricks). Also, she takes care of animals.

Her sister-in-law encouraged Edelmira to request a loan and to belong to the “Virgen de Fatima” community bank. With the first loan of 300 new soles, she bought cement and molds for her business. With this loan of 1,000 new soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy cement at wholesale in order to get a better price.

Edelmira’s goal is to help financially in her grandchildren’s education so that they can be professional and have their comforts.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira Leonor es madre soltera, tiene 55 años, estudió Superior Técnica, Secretariado Ejecutivo y Secretariado Comercial, hace unos años se jubiló, tiene 01 hija, la cual es independiente, Vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

La empresaria investigó y estudió sobre la fabricación de ladrillos en internet y de ahí ella empezó con el negocio, junto con sus nietos que son los que la apoyan. Ella posee moldes, máquinas vibradoras. Participa en ferias, donde muestra su trabajo (ladrillos). También se dedica a la crianza de animales.

Su cuñada la animó a solicitar el préstamo y pertenecer al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, compró cemento y moldes para el negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará cemento al por mayor para obtener mejor precio.

Tiene como meta, ayudar económicamente en la educación de sus nietos, para que sean buenos profesionales y tener sus comodidades.

loans.use: To buy cement at wholesale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nora Ricardina

texts.es:
Her love for cooking made Nora built a small restaurant in her own home. Her friends and neighbors gave her this idea when they tasted her delicious spice. At 53 years old, she is a mother to 6 children, all of which are of age and independent. Her husband Juan, when he is free from work, gives her loving support in her business. He makes cheese that Nora sells in her restaurant. The wish of this couple is to expand and equip their restaurant, and also purchase the ingredients for the foods that Nora prepares. For this, they present this loan petition to you with hopes of receiving a positive response.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Su amor por la cocina hizo que Nora construyera en su propio domicilio un pequeño restaurante, ya que sus amistades y vecinos le dieron esa idea al probar su rica sazón. A sus 53 años es madre de 6 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo Juan, cuando está libre de su trabajo, la apoya con mucho amor en su negocio, él se dedica a la elaboración de quesos, que Nora vende en su restaurante.El deseo de esta pareja es ampliar e implementar su restaurante, aparte de comprar los alimentos para las comidas que Nora hace, por ello, es que presentan esta solicitud de préstamo ante ustedes, con la esperanza de recibir un respuesta positiva.

loans.use: To better and expand her restaurant, and to purchase ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana Nila is married and is 33 years old. She studied to be an executive secretariat, but she never practiced because she was taking care of her son, who is 9 years old and is an elementary-school student.

The businesswoman sells appetizers in her house, which is in the Moche district in Trujillo, La Libertad. She works every day from 9:00 a.m., taking advantage of the fact that the “Hospital del Seguro” of Moche is located in front of her house. She decided to request a loan from Manuela R. because of the profits and the opportunity of working among women. The first loan that she received was for 300 new soles; she invested this into the purchase of soda, which she offered with the appetizers.

She belongs to Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia.” With this loan of 700 new soles, which she will repay in four months, she plans to buy soda at wholesale directly from the factory in order to get the best price.

Her goal is to help her mother and support the education of her son so that he will be a good professional. She also dreams of having a bigger restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana Nila está casada, tiene 33 años, estudió secretariado ejecutivo, pero nunca la ejerció porque se dedicó al cuidado de su hijo el cual tiene la edad de 09 años y es estudiante del nivel Primario.

La empresaria se dedica a la venta de piqueos en su casa, en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Vende todos los días, a partir de las 9:00 a.m. aprovechando que al frente de su casa se encuentra el Hospital del Seguro de Moche. Decidió solicitar el préstamo a Manuela R., por los beneficios y la oportunidad de trabajar entre mujeres. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, ha invertido en la compra de gaseosa las que oferta junto con los piqueos.

Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “SANTA LUCIA”. Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, piensa comprar gaseosa al por mayor directamente de la fabrica para obtener mejor precio.

Tiene como meta ayudar a su mamá y apoyar en la educación de su hijo para que sea un buen profesional y sueña con tener un restaurante más grande.

loans.use: To buy sodas at wholesale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Juvino

texts.es:
Juvino is a single parent dedicated to carpentry and fine woodworking, he is 63 years old, and has dedicated himself to this activity for a long time. He lives with his two children, his sister Lucero who supports him immensely, even in his job. He feels proud of having a united family that supports each other in everything. Due to his efficient work in door, window, and furniture reconstruction, among others, he is highly solicited. However, he does not have a well equipped workshop and he is always renting some tools, which results costly. This is why now he has promised himself to refurbish and equip his workshop, and for this he is in need of a loan. With your support he will be able to fulfill his purpose.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Juvino es un padre de familia soltero dedicado a la carpintería y ebanistería, tiene 63 años, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, vive con sus 2 hijos y su hermana Lucero, quien lo apoya mucho, incluso con su trabajo. Él se siente orgulloso de tener una familia unida que confraternizan en todo. Por su eficiente trabajo en la reconstrucción de puertas, ventanas, muebles, entre otros, es muy solicitado. Sin embargo, no cuenta con un taller bien implementado, siempre tiene que estar alquilando algunas herramientas, lo que no le sale a cuenta, es por eso que ahora se prometió implementar y arreglar su taller y para ello estima de un préstamo y con su apoyo podrá realizar su propósito.

loans.use: Workshop refurbishment and purchase of carpentry tools.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa Mercedes is a street vendor that sells food during the breakfast and lunch times outside of a health stand near her home. She is the mother of 7 children; all grown up and with their own families. Presently, she lives only with her husband Hugo, who supports her very much with the business. Rosa Mercedes wants to grow her business. In order to do that, she will need to expand and fix the the surroundings and environment of her business and with some time, Rosa Mercedes wants to be able to establish the restaurant at her home since it is located in a commercial zone. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan to improve her food stand and be able to establish the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg

Rosa Mercedes vende comida a la hora del desayuno y el almuerzo de manera ambulante, en la afueras de un puesto de salud cerca su casa, es madre de 7 hijos, todos ya con su propia familia, en la actualidad sólo vive con su esposo Hugo, quien la apoya mucho en su negocio.Rosa Mercedes quiere crecer, para eso desea ampliar y arreglar los ambientes de su negocio y con el tiempo poner un restaurante en su casa, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona comercial, para lograr este propósito solicita el presente préstamo para la mejora de su puesto de comida y con ello la implementación de un restaurante.

loans.use: Investment capital to start a restaurant and discontinue selling food on the street.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia is 42 years old and has 3 children. Her children are her motivation to go on and prosper in everything. She sells goods and consumables and staple goods. She is also the owner of a motocar, which is driven and administered by her husband, Wilson. In the future she wants to expand her store. For that reason, she wants to buy more merchandise and fix some of the structures for the expansion. That's why through this media she asks for your support for a loan which she will pay promptly on the alloted time.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Rogelia tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, los mismos que son su razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, también es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado y administrado por su esposo Wilson. En el futuro quiere ver su bodega más grande, por ello, quiere comprar más mercadería y arreglar algunas estructuras para la ampliación. Es así, que por este medio, solicita su apoyo con un préstamo de dinero, el cual pagará puntualmente en el plazo indicado.

loans.use: To extend her pantry/grocery store and buy merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Edith Silvana

texts.es:
For many years, Edith has dedicated herself to sell fuel at her location. For diverse reasons, she had to interrupt this activity for some time but now she has return to continue working on this business. She has to start from zero again and it is tough for her but that doesn't dampen or limits her desire to go on. She has built her business again in front of her home but her limited capital doesn't help her to meet the demands for her service. That's why she is asking for a loan to increase the amount of fuel quantity in her business to meet the needs. Edith asks through this media for support at this time of economic need. With a thankful heart, she blesses any support that can be given to her.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Edith es una mujer que por muchos años se dedicó a la venta de combustible en su localidad, por diversas circunstancias, tuvo que interrumpir su actividad por un tiempo, ahora ha vuelto, pero tiene que empezar de cero y esto es muy duro para ella, pero no limita sus deseos de seguir adelante.A instalado nuevamente su negocio en la puerta de su casa, sin embargo, el capital el que cuenta no le ayuda para abastecer la demanda, por ello, solicita un préstamo para incrementar su cantidad de combustible. Edith acude a este medio por un apoyo en este momento de necesidad económica, con un corazón agradecido, bendice el apoyo que le puedan brindar.

loans.use: Increasing the investment capital for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elena Herlinda

texts.es:
Thanks to her mom, Elena is a woman that learn to cook and the taste and seasoning of her food are admirable.That's how she uses her talent to earn her income. She rented a stand inside the market and sells food. Her earnings will increase if she didn't have to pay the monthly rent. That's why she asks for a loan to get her own stand. The money that she will get from the loan will serve as an initial payment. She will not have to pay monthly rent but pay to own her stand. With better earnings, she will be able to build a home in the future where her 4 children can grow and develop adequately.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Elena es una mujer que gracias a su madre aprendió a cocinar, y su sazón es admirable, es así que utiliza este talento para ganarse la vida, alquiló un puesto dentro de un mercado y vende comida. Sus ganancias aumentarían si no tuviera que pagar mes a mes el arrendamiento. Por ello, solicita un préstamo, para que pueda adquirir un puesto propio, el dinero que le puedan prestar le servirá de inicial, ya no pagaría mensual un alquiler, sino la compra de su puesto. Con mejores ganancias, en el futuro podrá construir su casa, donde puedan crecer y desarrollarse adecuadamente sus 4 hijos.

loans.use: Buying a stand to sell food.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria and her husband administer their motocars that with a lot of effort they were able to adquire. They rent them and use them to transport passengers. In addition to this service, Maria works at the municipality of her location. Maria now wishes to buy an additional motocar for her business and increase her income to support the household. With time and work she will like to realize her dream of having a motocar enterprise and be a prosperous entrepreneur. The amount that she requires to buy the moto is 534 soles (Peruvian currency), money that she asks as a loan from you and hopes for a positive response.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

María y su esposo administran sus motocarros, que con mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir, los alquilan para transporte D. pasajeros, además D. esto, eventualmente, trabaja en la municipalidad D. su localidad.Ahora María, desea comprar una moto más para su negocio y así tener mayor soporte económico en su hogar, con el tiempo concretar su sueño D. tener una empresa D. motocarros y ser una próspera empresaria.El monto que requiere para la compra D. su moto es D. 534 soles, dinero que lo solicita como préstamo ante usted y espera una respuesta positiva.

loans.use: Buying an additional motocar for their business.

loans.name: Silvia Luz

texts.es:
Silvia suffered the deception and abandonment of the father of their children. This situation caused her to suffer a terrible depression that she was able to overcome thanks to her parents. Now she is dedicated to raise her small children and to her work. She has a mechanic shop which is their family business and she hopes that it will continue to grow.

Silvia lives with her parents who support her in her day to day tasks. Even though this business is very profitable, she wishes to have her own business to run simultaneously to the mechanic shop and increase the income. Her wish is to sell clothes at the local fairs and she presents her case before you in order to ask for an economical loan that will help her to purchase merchandise for her new business

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Silvia sufrió el engaño y abandono del padre de sus hijos, ocasionando en ella una terrible depresión que pudo superar gracias a sus padres.Ahora está dedicada a sus pequeños hijos y a su trabajo, tiene un taller mecánico, el que es negocio familiar y espera que siga creciendo. Silvia vive junto a sus padres, quienes la apoyan en su labor día a día.A pesar de que este negocio es muy rentable, ella desea tener un negocio propio, que pueda llevar paralelamente a la mecánica y aumentar sus ingresos, su deseo es vender ropa en las ferias de su localidad. Y presenta su caso ante ustedes para que con un préstamo económico le ayuden a comprar mercadería para su nuevo negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to start an additional business.

loans.name: Rosa Constanza

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Costanza is married. She studied until fourth graD. in elementary school because her family didn’t have money for her to continue studying. She has seven children, five of whom work and two who are high school students. For five years, she has been selling caramels in her house in the Salaverry district in Trujillo, La Libertad.

Through a neighbor, she joined “Las Emprendedoras” community bank, and she has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought cookies and caramels, with which she supplied her business.

With a loan of 500 new soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy toilet paper and detergents that were needed in her business. Rosa dreams of having a big grocery business, so that she can support the education of her small children.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Constanza está casada, estudió hasta 4to grado D. Primaria, porque su familia no tenía recursos económicos para que siguiera estudiando, tiene 07 hijos, 05 trabajan y 02 son estudiantes del nivel secundario. Hace cinco años se dedica a la venta D. caramelos en su casa en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

Por medio D. una vecina ingresa en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, hace un año viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró galletas, caramelos, con lo cual ha logrado surtir el negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 04 meses, comprará papel higiénico y detergentes que hacen falta en su negocio. La socia sueña con tener un negocio granD. D. abarrotes, para apoyar en la educación D. sus hijos pequeños.

loans.use: To buy personal products to sell in her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
Miss Nelly Nancy is 41 years old. She studied until the second year of high school and lives with her parents in the Moche district, in the province of Trujillo, which is in the La Libertad region.

She began selling “chocotejas” (traditional Peruvian chocolates). Now she sells food in her home. She decided to pursue another activity because her earlier business was not profitable; in the summer, the sale of chocotejas declines.

For two years, she has been working with Manuela Ramos. She received a loan for 300 new soles, invested it in the purchase of chocolate, delicacies, and dry fruits, and succeeding in increasing her earnings so that she could continue to work.

She belongs to the Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ.” With this loan of 500 new soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy platters, table settings, etc so that she can continue to increase her business.

Miss Nelly, who works every day, wants to prosper. She not only shares her earnings with her mother, but she also dreams of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Nelly Nancy tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria y vive en el distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, con sus padres.

La socia inició vendiendo chocotejas, marcianos. Ahora se dedica a la venta de comida, en su casa. Ella decidió dedicarse a otra actividad, porque el anterior negocio no era rentable, ya que en el verano, la venta de chocotejas disminuye.

Hace 02 años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, recibió un préstamo de S/. 300.00, invertido en la compra de chocolate, manjar Y frutas secas, logró incrementar la ganancia para seguir trabajando.

Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ”. Con este crédito de S/. 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará fuentes, cubiertos, etc., para seguir implementando el negocio.

La señorita Nelly, trabaja todos los días, quiere prosperar, además comparte el beneficio con su Mamá y sueña con tener un restaurante.

loans.use: To buy utensils (platters, table settings, etc.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es:
Melanio is 62 years old, he lives alone as he never married, although he has four children. None of them live with him. Melanio comments that he couldn't access a good education and so he only received a basic primary education. For this reason he had to help his father from when he was very small in the 'oleria' (a brick-making site). With time, the business passed down to him and today he still manages the brick-making business.

He assures that the business is going well as he has a well formed customer base and constant work. He has thoughts of opening a business selling construction materials in the future, such as: stones, rocks, rods, lime and cement.

In this case, he will invest the loan in the purchase of firewood in large quantities, which is used in the manufacture of his products.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Melanio tiene 62 años, vive sólo porque nunca se casó aunque tiene 4 hijos. Ninguno de los mismos vive con él. Melanio comenta que no pudo acceder a una buena educación ya que solo pudo cursar la educación básica primaria. Por tal motivo tuvo que ayudar a su padre desde muy pequeño en la olería (lugar donde se fabrican ladrillos). Con el tiempo el negocio pasó a ser de él y hoy día ya lo administra el mismo.

Asegura que le va muy bien debido a que tiene clientela ya formada y el trabajo es constante. Tiene pensado en el futuro abrir un negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como: piedras, ladrillos, varillas, cal y cemento.

En esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo en la compra de leñas en grandes cantidades, las cuales son utilizadas en la cocción de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es:
Lorreine is 44 years old. She rents rooms that she installed in her house: she's been doing this for the last 4 and a half years, and it is going very well. In addition, she's a good dress-maker, and as a result she wants to open a new sewing workshop. She is a women with entrepreneurial vision, as she also wants to expand and improve some of her rooms. She is a single woman, with four children, three of whom are independent, with the only the last still in her care. In order to renovate some of her rooms she is asking for the present loan so she can complete the planned project.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Lorreine tiene 44 años, alquila habitaciones que implementó en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 4 años y medio y le va muy bien. También es una buena costurera, por ello quiere abrir nuevamente un taller D. costura, es una mujer con visión D. negocio, pues quiere ampliar y mejorar algunas D. sus habitaciones. Es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, siendo tres D. ellos independientes, y quedando el último aún a su cargo. Para refaccionar algunas D. sus habitaciones solicita el presente préstamo y cumplir así lo que tiene pensado.

loans.use: Renovate the rooms that she rents in her house.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
As a result of her dedication and care in textile arts, now Maritza is a great exporter of clothes and much in demand for her designs. Maritza studied textiles and is now 37 years old and the mother of one daughter. For her, the most important thing is her business, and for this reason she has decided to hire a site to establish her textile workshop (as she currently can be found working from a space her mother has given her) in order to provide a suitable space. However, to achieve this she needs a loan and she asks for your help through this medium.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Por su dedicación y esmero en el arte textil, ahora es una gran exportadora de ropa y muy solicitaD. por sus confecciones. Maritza estudió arte textil, tiene 37 años y es madre de 1 niña. Para ella, lo más importante es su negocio, por eso decidió alquilar un local para poner su taller textil (ya que se encuentra ocupando un espacio que le brindó su madre) para ambientarlo como es debido, sin embargo, para esto requiere de un capital para cumplir su objetivo y solicita su apoyo mediante este medio.

loans.use: Rent a site to establish her textile workshop

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda is 60 years old. She is a very active woman: she sells snacks in an Education Institute during the school terms. In the vacations she sells groceries from her house. She has continued working in order to held her daughter-in-law with the education of her grandchildren, as due to the death of one of her sons, her daughter-in-law and grandchildren came to live with her. With time, Magda wants to sell wholesale (groceries and candy): for this, she needs a loan which will help her to achieve her aim in a short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Magda tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy activa, venD. durante el tiempo escolar golosinas en una Institución Educativa, en vacaciones se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su casa, ella sigue trabajando para apoyar a su nuera con la educación D. sus nietos, ya que con la muerte D. uno D. sus hijos, su nuera y sus nietos vinieron a vivir con ella. Con el tiempo, Magda quiere vender al por mayor (abarrotes y golosinas) para esto, requiere D. un capital que la ayuD. a lograr su meta en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nelly Gisela

texts.es:
Nelly, aged 31, works cultivating camu camu (a native fruit from the Peruvian rainforest), and also sells vegetables as an ambulatory salesman in different places in the area. She has three young children who are still studying. Her husband Alexander helps her a lot, above all in cultivation, and it is he who works caring for the plants. Nelly requires a sum of money, the loan she's requesting, which she will invest in the purchase of a tricycle to move their plants, and to transport the vegetables they sell. Later they will buy a motorized bike.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nelly de 31 años se dedica al cultivo de camu camu (fruto nativo de la selva del Perú), también se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares de su zona, ella tiene tres hijos menores aún están estudiando. Su esposo Alexander la apoya mucho, sobre todo en sus cultivos, y es quien se dedica al cuidado de sus plantas. Nelly requiere de una suma de dinero, préstamo que solicita, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un triciclo para movilizar sus plantas, y para transportar las verduras que vende, posteriormente comprar un motocarro.

loans.use: Purchase of a tricycle for transporting her plants and vegetables

loans.name: La Bendición Group

texts.en:
C. S. is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children (ages 9, 7, and 4) in a small Haitian community called Guayabal in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling clothing 2 years ago and is using the loan to increase her inventory. C. travels by bus from town to town selling her products to the small communities in the countryside as many of these rural people do not have the means to travel to town to do their shopping. She started this clothing business to earn additional income so that she can provide her family with a good education and comfortable home. In C.´s free time, she enjoys going to church, reading the Bible, and spending time with her children.

C. is the leader of the 15-person micro-bank group, La Bendición. In English, this means "the blessing." Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. On behalf of C., the Bendición group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this $3275 micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, undergarments, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Comité San Antonio Group

texts.es:
The San Antonio group was established on 26 May 2008.  This group was organised thanks to the fact that the current President, Felicia González (dress-maker and hairdresser), approached Fundación Paraguaya to ask for an assessment as she had previously participated in another group and wanted to belong to a new one together with her neighbours.  The meeting with the organisation was a success and this is how today 15 women are working together in solidarity.
The members of this group are using their loan to fund different activities such as : sale of cleaning products, sale of eggs, snacks, meals and drinks, sewing, sale of honey and honeycakes.
The same members participate in weekly meetings and undertake activities to collect funds.  The group works co-operatively, demonstrating companionship and solidarity.
 Felicia, Bernarda, Cinthya, Sonia, Felicita, Liliana, Justa, María, Ana, Lourdes, Elsi, Lucila, Diana, Pablina and Valeriana now want a loan to invest in their respective businesses and in this way they will be able to increase their production and their incomes.
Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
El Grupo denominado San Antonio, se conformó en fecha 26 de mayo de2008, dicho grupo fue organizado, gracias a que la actual presidenta del grupo, Felicia González de profesión modista y peluquera, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya, para pedir asesoramiento ya que ella, anteriormente ya participo en otro grupo y quería conformar uno nuevo junto con sus vecinas. La reunión de organización fue un éxito y es así como hoy 15 señoras están juntas trabajando solidariamente.
Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de huevos, golosinas, comidas y bebidas, trabajos de costura, venta de miel y tortas de miel.
Las mismas participan activamente en las reuniones  semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos. El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad.
Las señoras Felicia, Bernarda, Cinthya, Sonia, Felicita, Liliana, Justa, María, Ana, Lourdes, Elsi, Lucila, Diana, Pablina y Valeriana hoy desean un crédito para poder invertirlos en sus respectivos negocios ya que de este modo ellas lograrán aumentar su producción e ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase threads and materials, cleaning products, meat, flour, noodles, oil, honey, eggs, dairy products, snacks, sugar, sweets etc.

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Eugenio Colmán, tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian aún en la escuela primaria de la ciudad.

Blanca trabaja como docente con una antigüedad de 19 años y su marido trabajaba en ventas varias hasta hace un año atrás. Blanca debido a la necesidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, y gracias al sacrificio de tantos años de labores educativas y con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo decidieron abrir una pequeña despensa la cual es atendida por su esposo.

Hoy en día, y después de un año de mucho esfuerzo, la pequeña despensa ha aumentado tanto en diversidad de mercaderías como también en cantidad de clientes; tanto fue su crecimiento que están vendiendo carnes, artículos de mercería, bazar y juguetería.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para adquirir mercaderías azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros, en gran cantidad y así poder obtener un poco más de ganancias, las cuales les ayudarán en el crecimiento educativo de sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías como azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidos (United Women) Group 6

texts.en:
Cloreta Y. lives in a very poor Haitian community outside of El Seybo with her husband, her youngest child (18 years old) and two grandchildren. Her three other children (ages 22, 26 and 29) live in the city of Higuey. Cloreta has a small collection of food products, a “paletera,” that she stores in her house and sells to her neighbors. She says the most difficult thing about her business is having enough money to buy rice, because it is in high demand but also very expensive. Cloreta has successfully paid back four loans to Esperanza and is now requesting her fourth. With this loan of $900, she plans to buy even more products to sell so that she can increase her profits and improve her way of life. She and the other four members of her group are pictured here, meeting with their loan officer to prepare to receive the next loan. This group is part of the larger Bank of Hope called “Mujeres Unidas,” or United Women.

Note: This is a group loan for five people. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food and grow her business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 43 years old, is married with Mr. Eugenio Colman, has 4 children, they are still on elementary school.

Blanca has been working as a teacher for 19 years and her husband worked in sells until the last year. Because of the necessity to improve the quality of life for her kids and thanks to the long years of educational work, and the unconditional support of her husband they decided to open a small grocery store that is attended by her husband.
