Elles font généralement le commerce de condiments, de savons, du bois de chauffe, d’habits, de chaussures et aussi la couture. Les membres du groupe Sountoura sont unis par des relations d’alliances, de groupe d’âge et de voisinage. Ensemble elles ont décidés de solliciter un prêt à Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur première expérience. Avec ce prêt elles achèteront 30 mètres de tissu à coudre, 30 habits pour enfants, 20 paires de chaussures, une grande quantité de condiments, 1 carton de savon de toilette, 20 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, etc. Elles s’approvisionnement en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans détenant un permis de coupe de bois aux villages environnants de la ville de Ségou. Pour les autres articles, les achats sont effectués au marché de Ségou ou à Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Les ventes sont effectuées à comptant le plus souvent au marché de Ségou et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages aux alentours de Ségou généralement en détail et à comptant à une clientèle majoritairement féminine. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles souhaitent acheter dans le futur une machine à broder les tissus pour améliorer la qualité des habits.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Yankadi( Ici C’Est Bon) Group

texts.fr:
The 9 members of the Yankadi group are, on average, 44 years old with 4 children. The majority live in traditional families in the Sokala area of Dagala (Region of Ségou, Republic of Mali). They sell charcoal, firewood, grains and condiments. They have come together because of friendship, family relations and professional ties. The Benkadi Dagala association, to which the Yankadi group belongs, has received many training courses in the context of support for rural organizations provided by the non-governmental organization FIDA. In search of financial resources, this group has already worked with several microfinance institutions but finally decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is receiving its second group loan after the first was easily repaid. The women intend to purchase 90 cartloads of firewood and 15 bags of charcoal, locally and in neighboring areas (Dougasso, Zenguena, Gachin and Fombougou), 15 bags of millet (in Dagala, Siguila and Mèfa), and condiments at the large market in the city of Ségou. They generally sell their products at retail prices for cash or on credit at the market in Ségou or door-to-door, for the charcoal and firewood. They sell the condiments door-to-door in the village and on market days in the neighboring villages. Their clientele is made up of all types of people (men and women, young and old). They would like to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay the interest on the loan and meet their families’ needs. They would also like to work to create a non-governmental organization to restore and protect their ecosystem.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les neuf (9) membres du groupe Yankadi ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 4 enfants, vivent en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Sokala de Dagala (Région de Ségou République du Mali). Elles exercent le commerce du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe, des céréales et des condiments alimentaires. Elles se sont regroupées en raison de liens d’amitié, de parenté et de travail. L’association Benkadi Dagala, a laquelle le groupe Yankadi appartient, a bénéficié de beaucoup de formations organisées dans le cadre de l’appui aux organisations paysannes par l’organisation non gouvernementale FIDA. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières, ce groupe ayant eu à travailler avec plusieurs institutions de microfinance décida de rejoindre finalement Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son deuxième prêt de groupe et le précédent fut remboursé sans difficulté. Elles comptent acheter 90 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 15 sacs de charbon de bois sur place et aux environs (à Dougasso, Zenguena, Gachin et Fombougou), 15 sacs de mil (à Dagala, Siguila et Mèfa) et les condiments dans le grand marché de la ville de Ségou. La vente se fait généralement à Ségou en détail au comptant et à crédit sur place au marché ou en ambulant pour le charbon de bois et le bois de chauffe. Quant aux condiments, la vente s’effectue au village à domicile et les jours des foires des villages environnants. La clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales (hommes et femmes, jeunes et vieux). Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la familles. Elles souhaitent œuvrer pour la création d’une organisation non gouvernementale pour restaurer et protéger leur écosystème.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, grains and charcoal

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
The 5 women in the Danaya group are all married and are, on average, 38 years old with 6 children. They live in polygamous families in the Sogomougou region of the Koutiala prefecture (third most important economic region in Mali). Brought together by professional, friendship and neighborly ties, the members of the group trust one another and have been working together for years. They are very experienced in business and primarily sell various items, fresh, smoked and grilled fish, wheat flour, clothing and plastic cups. In addition, they serve food and dye clothing, which they learned to do from relatives in these lines of business. In order to increase the size of their business, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. They are on their tenth group loan, having fully repaid all of the previous loans. With this loan, they would like to purchase at wholesale prices plastic cups, imported from Abidjan (the capital of Cote d’Ivoire), fish, and a large supply of raw materials to dye “bazin” cloth (which is a highly sought-after type of cloth in West Africa). They sell their products in the city of Koutiala and at the markets in neighboring villages to a clientele made up of restaurant owners, shopkeepers, housewives and traveling salesmen. They intend to earn a profit of 100,000 CFA francs each, which will be used to repay the interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan and help pay their families’ daily expenses. In the future, the Danaya group would like to diversify its business by taking up more profitable activities.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les cinq femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 6 enfants vivant dans des familles polygames au quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région économique du Mali). Liées par des relations professionnelles, d’amitié et de voisinage, les membres de ce groupe se font confiance et sont ensembles depuis des années. Très expérimentées dans les activités économiques, elles mènent essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers, la vente de poissons frais, fumés et grillés, de la farine de blé, des habits, des tasses en plastiques. En plus elles font de la restauration et de la teinture d’habits apprises auprès de parents exerçant ces activités. Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt elles vont acheter en gros des tasses en plastiques importées d’Abidjan (la capitale de la république de la Côte d’ivoire), du poisson et une importante quantité de matières premières pour la teinture des tissus bazin (tissu très prisé en Afrique de l’Ouest). Elles vendent leurs produits dans la ville de Koutiala et les marchés des villages voisins à une clientèle composée de restaurateurs, de boutiquiers, de ménagères et d’ambulants. Elles comptent réaliser chacune 100.000 CFA de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérets du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille. Dans l’avenir, le Groupe Danaya compte diversifier ses activités en intégrant d’autres opérations plus rentables.

loans.use: Purchase of fish, plastic cups and dying materials

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en:
Bernadeta F. is 36 years old. She is a married woman with a 12 year old child. She owns a small general store which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Bernadeta now hopes for a loan of $325 to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy F. is 30 years old.She is a married woman with 3 children ages 9, 6 and 4. She became a banana seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 7.30am to 8.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Happy now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 31 years,She is a married woman with 1 child aged 6. She became a maize seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija E. is 31 years old. She is a married woman with a six year old child. She became a maize seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es:
Mr. Cayo M. is 49 and married to 41-year-old Artemia Villar. They have four children, all boys, all of whom are students who live at home.

Cayo has been a retailer since 2002; he owns his own shop where he sells electronics. The business began with the liquidation of his old office, a butcher's shop where he worked for 12 years. At first, Cayo sold articles of clothing and later began selling electronics.

Loan proceeds will be used toward the purchase of Philips brand DVD equipment. Looking ahead, Cayo is thinking about carrying televisions, sound systems and other home electronics, which would necessitate that he expand his store.

For his country of Paraguay, Cayo, like the great majority of its inhabitants, hopes for more sources of work and better distribution of wealth.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Cayo M. tiene 49 años esta casado con la Señora Artemia Villar de 41 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene 4 hijos varones, todos estudiante y viven con ellos.

Desde el año 2002 Don Cayo es comerciante y tiene un local propio donde pone en venta artículos de electrónica, en dicho negocio se inició con la liquidación de su antiguo oficio como empleado de una carniceria, donde trabajó por 12 años. Primeramente se dedicó a vender a prendas de vestir para posteriormente vender los artículos electrónicos.

El dinero del préstamo será para la compra de equipos de DVD, marca Philips en oferta. Más adelante está pensando traer televisores, equipos de sonido y otros electrodomésticos, para lo cual tendrà que ampliar el local.

Para nuestro pais desea, como la gran mayoria de sus habitantes, fuentes de trabajo y mejor distribución de las riquezas.

loans.use: <b>Purchase of Philips Brand DVD Equipment<b>

loans.name: Flora's Ikunda Group

texts.en:
Flora S. is 30 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 10 and 6. She owns a small general store which she started in 1996. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Flora now hopes for a loan of $1525 to buy more rice commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, and banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Eliwandetha

texts.en:
Eliwandetha is 31 years,She is a married woman with 1 children aged 3 . She owns a small general store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Eliwandetha now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, commodities for her business.

loans.use: To more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy A., 19, is single and lives with her parents. She is currently a student in one of the most prestigious universities in the city.

From a very young age, Deisy A. assisted her mother with the family business, which consisted of running a telephone booth. In doing so, Deisy gained the trust of her parents. Thanks to her consistent attention to detail and her persistence, her mother decided to hand over her position in this small company to Deisy in 2005. At the moment, her shop is already quite well-known and approved by the community.

Deisy will use the loan proceeds for the purchase of phone cards for recharging the balances of mobile phones and for equipment.

Deisy maintains that if we do not change our mentality, we cannot get ahead, as that is the first step.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La Señorita Deisy A. de 19 años de edad es soltera y vive con sus padres; se encuentra cursando sus estudios terciarios en una de las universidades mas prestigiosa de la ciudad.

Deisy A. desde muy joven ayudó a su madre en el negocio de la familia que consistía en una cabina telefónica, de este modo, Deisy se ganó la confianza de sus padres gracias a la buena atencion y empeño que demostro durante todo momento, su madre desidió dejarle a su cargo esta pequeña empresa aproximadamente en el año 2005; actualmente su locutorio ya es bastante conocida y concurrida por la gente.

La Señorita utilizaria este crédito para la compra de tarjetas para recarga de saldos de telefonos moviles y para equipar su local.

Deisy sostiene que si no cambiamos de mentalidad no saldremos adelante a si que ese es nuestro primer paso.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and merchandise, such as phone cards for recharging the balances of mobile phones

loans.name: Crispino

texts.es:
Crispino is 47 years old and married to Leoncia Bogado. He has five children, 3 of whom are older and 2 younger.

From a very young age, Crispino worked with his father in a carpentry shop where he learned how to be a carpenter. With the help of his wife who works in a diner, he was able to establish a carpentry shop from his home.

Crispino needs a loan to buy raw materials in bulk such as wood, nails, and glue, among others. In the future he would like to buy a vehicle to transport his work rather than paying to transport loads.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Crispino tiene 47 años esta casado con la señora Leoncia Bogado, tienen 5 hijos 3 mayores de edad y 2 menores.

Crispino desde muy joven trabajo con su padre en una carpintería en donde aprendió el oficio de carpintero, con la ayuda de su esposa que trabaja en un copetín pudo montar su carpintería en su domicilio.

Necesita este crédito para la compra de materiales en cantidad tales como maderas, clavos, pegamento, entre otros. En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus trabajos y no pagar fletes.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as wood, nails, glue for wood, paints and finishes, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is 62 years old and married to 59-year-old Amada Gonzalez. They have five children, all of whom are married and five of whom are professionals who have received degrees in Education.

Eduardo was working initially as a cattle butcher before he later decided to change professions. Eight years ago he began working as a taxi driver. During the first four years, he rented his friends' cars to use for taxi service. With the earnings he was able to save, he purchased a vehicle for himself. Eduardo is known as as one of the most attentive taxi drivers in the city of Caaguazú.

His dream is to buy a light truck to use in his taxi service, since this vehicle generates more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Don Eduardo T. de 62 años de edad esta casado con la Señora Amada Gonzalez de 59 años de edad; el matrimonio cuenta con 7 hijos, todos casados y cinco de ellos son profesionales recibidos de la carrera de Licenciatura de la Educación.

Don Eduardo trabajaba anteriormente como Faenador de animales vacunos, luego decidió cambiar de rubro. Hace ocho años se desempeña como taxista. En dicho rubro se inició alquilando vehiculos de sus amigos para realizar el servicio de taxi durante cuantro años. Luego con la platita que iba ganando y ahorrando se pudo comprar su propio vehiculo. Actualmente Don Eduardo ya es conocido en la Ciudad de Caaguazú como uno de los Taxistas que mejor atención ofrece a sus clientes.

Como sueño personal desea comprar una camioneta para utilizarla en el ramo del taxi, ya que dicho vehiculo genera mas ingresos.

loans.use:
For repairs for a car used for taxi service
Para la reparación del auto que utiliza para el servicio de taxi

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio F., 30, has been living for three years with his partner, Liduvina Cañete, who is 24. The pair has a one-year-old son.

For eight years, Emilio has headed a motorcycle repair shop where spare parts for motorcycles are also sold. Emilio began his current business with modest savings from his former position at another shop where he worked as a motorcycle mechanic. In his own shop, Emilio receives his brother's assistance.

Emilio already has a regular clientele thanks to the customized attention and quality service he provides. His dream is to extend the business to include the sale of spare parts.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare parts of motorcycles, such as: clutch and brakes, oils, chains, crowns, and pinions. He wants to offer his clients a full array of merchandise so that they are able to find everything they are looking for.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Emilio F. de 30 años de edad vive hace 3 años con su pareja, la señora Liduvina Cañete de 24 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad.

Desde hace ocho años, Don Emilio se encuentra al frente de un taller de Motos donde tambien tiene venta de repuestos para motos. En dicho rubro se inició con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba de su antiguo empleo en donde se desempeñaba como mecánico de motos para otro taller. En su taller recibe la ayuda de su hermano.

Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a su personalizada atención y de buena calidad. Como sueño personal desea ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de Repuestos para motos, táles como: cabo de embrague y frenos, aceites, cadenas, coronas, piñon. Para ofrecer a sus clientes un stock de mercaderias mas completa y el cliente pueda encontrar todo lo que busca.

loans.use: For the purchase of spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: "amanecer" Or "day Break" Group

texts.es:
The Amancecer or "day break" committee recently formed and is in their first cycle. The women live in an impoverished area, because of which the majority work in sales.

Of all of the women in the group we highlight the work of 60 year-old Serafina Zarcho. She is a single mother of 4 girls, which she raised with much effort and sacrifice. She comes from a large family and since she was a young girl has worked cleaning houses and washing clothes. When she was 16 she had her first child, and lived with the father for 7 years. Afterward she decided to separate from him because he treated her poorly, and Serafina took her daughter with her.

Then, as a woman, she learned to sew, knit, make clothes and sell them. She also taught her daughters these crafts and with them they were able to live. Currently, at 60 years of age, she cannot sew anymore because she suffers from arthritis. She decided to start a small snack-shop where she sells coals, sugar, herbs (for tea), flour, breads and other products.

Her greatest worry is the safety of her second daughter, Teodolina, who traveled to Argentina in search of a better job and left her three children under Serafina's care, as she has not heard from her in 6 months.

All of the women have different jobs, including food sales, clothing sales, make-up sales, cleaning products sales, pantry sales and traveling saleswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El comité AMANECER se conformo recientemente esta en su primer ciclo. Ellas viven en una zona humilde, por tal motivo la mayoría trabaja en venta casa por casa.

Entre todas las mujeres de grupo destacamos el trabajo de Serafina Zarcho de 60 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de 4 mujeres a quienes crió con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella proviene de una familia muy numerosa y desde pequeña trabajó limpiando casas y lavando ropa. Alos 16 años tuvo su primera hija, vivió en pareja siete años y luego decidió alejarse de su pareja por los maltratos que sufría, llevando con ella la carga de la familia.

Entonces aprendió de una señora para quien trabaja a bordar, tejer, y coser a máquina, confeccionaba prendas y vendía. También enseño a sus hijas este oficio y así consiguieron sobrevivir. Actualmente con sus 60 años ya no puede coser ni siquiera a mano, sufre de una avanzada artritis. Decidió entonces poner un pequeño Copetín en su casa donde vende carbón, azúcar, yerba, harina, panes, y otros productos.

Su gran preocupación es su segunda hija, Teodolina, quien viajó a la Argentina en busca de mejor empleo y dejó a sus tres niños a cuidado de Serafina y no tiene noticias de su hija hace ya casi seis meses.

Todas las señoras poseen actividades diferentes entre ellas venta de comestibles, venta de ropas, venta de maquillajes, productos de limpieza, despensas y vendedoras ambulantes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, lingerie, beauty products such as cream and perfume, meat, flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables in greater quantities.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Martintez is 26 years-old.  He has been married for 8 years to his 31 year-old wife, Maria Cantero.  They have four children; two are in high school and two are not yet school-age.

Mr. Francisco has been a traveling salesman since 2007, which he began with money he saved during the seven years the couple worked out of the country.  Mr. Francisco is also an independent building contractor. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase athletic shoes, jeans, a bead spread, blouse, shirt, capri pants, blankets and other seasonal clothing.  With these items he will be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers. 

 Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer>

El Sr. Francisco M. de 26 años de edad, esta casado hace 8 años con la Sra. Maria Cantero de 31 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando la secundaria y los otros dos no tienen aun eded escolar. 

Don Francisco se dedica al vendedor ambulante, en dicho oficio se inició en el año de 2007 con un pequeño ahorro que venia juntando la pareja ya que estuvieron trabajando por más de siete años en el extranjero, luego decidieron volver al pais para dedicarse a este rubro y trabajando en forma conjunta, además el señor es constructor de obras y suele realizar trabajo en forma independiente. 

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados deportivos pantalón de jeans, colcha, blusas, remera, capri, frazadas y otras prendas de la estación. De este modo para ofrecer mayor variedad a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase athletic shoes, jeans, a bead spread, blouse, shirt, capri pants, blankets and other seasonal clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Ms. Gladys is divorced with one university-aged son. Gladys is very proud of her son who is also her best friend. Gladys owns a sewing workshop in her house. She began sewing with her aunt, who taught her much about the craft. Later, with her savings, she purchased a sewing machine and began working independently.

The loan that she is requesting she will use to enlarge her house which will allow her to have a larger workshop. The extra space will allow for a fitting room for her clients.

Ms. Gladys' dream is to one day have her own brand of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gladys es divorciada, tiene un hijo mayor estudiante universitario del cual ella esta muy orgullosa pues es su mejor amigo, y un ejemplo como hijo. Ella posee un taller de costura en su casa. Se inicio en la costura con una tía con la que trabajo varios años y le enseño lo que sabe, luego, con sus ahorros compro una máquina de coser y se independizo.

El crédito que solicita desea destinarlo para la ampliación de su vivienda y así poder tener un taller más amplio para dar comodidad a sus clientas que vienen a su casa a probarse los vestidos que ella les cose.

La señora Gladys sueña con algún día poder tener su propia marca de ropas.

loans.use: Enlarging her house

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Ms. Gladis B. is 33 years old and divorced. She has a school-aged son.

Ms. Gladis began selling used shoes with her husband 19 years ago, and about 3 years ago began her own mini-business. Gladis always has the latest merchandise at a great price, because of which she has been able to form a solid client base, and her business has flourished. She is asking for a loan to purchase additional used shoes to have a greater variety in her store.

She thinks that today's youth are today's hope and today's children are the hope of the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Gladis B. de 33 años se encuentra separada de su marido, tiene 1 hijo que esta cursando sus estudios primarios.

Doña Gladis se inicio con su marido en venta de zapatos usados hace como 19 años, y hace 3 años aproximadamente, ella esta al frente de su microempresa, la señora Gladis posee constantemente mercaderías muy novedosas a muy buenprecio, por ello su negocio tiene exito y con una clientela totalmente formada. La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas zapatos usados para tener mas variedades.

Piensa que los jovenes son la esperanza de hoy y los niños son la esperanza del futuro.

loans.use: Purchase additional used shoes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Mr. Jose is 34 years old, married to his wife, Adela, and has three young children.

Jose buys and sells musical instruments and accessories, and has been doing so for the past 7 years. He inherited this job from this parents, who continue working in the music business, and frequently travel to Argentina to import the merchandise. Adela works in the production of sleeves or cases for guitars and harps, using a special machine.

Mr. Jose is asking for the loan to purchase string, tuning pegs, and guitars.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Jose tiene 34 años, esta casado con la señora Adela y tienen 3 hijos todos menores de edad.

El Sr. Jose se dedica a la compra y venta de instrumentos y accesorios musicales hace 7 años, este trabajo lo heredero de sus padres quien hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando en lo mismo viajando a la Argentina como mayoristas e importando las mercaderías. Adela se dedica a la confección de las fundas o estuches para las guitarra y arpas con una maquina industrial que tienen en la casa especial para este tipo de costuras.

El Sr. Jose solicita este crédito para la compra de accesorios como cuerda, clavija y guitarras.

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments and accessories.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Mr. Oscar M. is an unmarried 19 year-old man. He lives in the city of Caaguazú with his parents.

When he was young, Oscar began to work in a shop where he learned how to market products and met many potential clients. Two years ago he started to work independently, and with his savings from this previous job was able to open his own business.

Currently, Oscar operates a general store. He works as a traveling salesman throughout the different areas of the city of Caaguazú. Oscar already has a strong client base within the city.

Oscar is asking for a loan to purchase jackets, as they have been frequently requested of him for the winter season.

He hopes that the new government of our country works better than the previous one.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Oscar M. tiene 19 años, es soltero y vive en la Ciudad de Caaguazú con sus padres.

Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar como empleado de una tienda en donde aprendiò sobre la comercialización de productos y conoció a muchos clientes potenciales. Hace 2 años se independizó y con el pequeño dinero que venia ahorando de su anterior empleo emprendió su propio negocio.

Oscar, actualmente se dedica a la venta de articulos de bazar y merceria y se desempeña como vendedor ambulante por las variadas zonas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, recorre con una motocicleta. Cabe mencionar que Oscar ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada por las zonas aledañas de la Ciudad.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de camperas ya que tiene muchos pedidos de ese producto por la estación de invierno que llegó.

Espera que el nuevo gobierno de nuestro pais funcione mejor que el gobierno anterior.

loans.use: To purchase jackets

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Mr. Roman J. is 53 years old, and has been married for 26 years to Mrs. Julia Villasanti, age 47. The couple has six children of whom four are living at home and the other two are working abroad; the children living with them are attending primary and secondary school.

Roman is at the forefront of a small store and meat market which began in 2003 with the savings from his previous work. His wife assists him in his business; she prepares dishes such as pies, cakes and breaded meat.

He is seeking a loan to purchase meat, sausages, rice, flour, noodles, peaches, sugar, milk, oil, herb and soft drinks. This way he can supply his business and give his customers a wider range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Roman J. de 53 años de edad, esta casado hace 26 años con la Sra. Julia Villasanti de 47 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales cuatro estan viviendo con ellos y los otro dos están trabajando en el exterior; los hijos que vive con ellos están cursando la primaria y secundaria.

Don Roman se encuentra al frente de una Despensa y carnicería en la cual se inició en el año de 2003 con un capital de ahorro, fruto de su anterior trabajo. En dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien tambien se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles como empanada, tortas y milanesas.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de carnes, chorizo, arroz, harina, fideos, dulce de durazno, azucar, leche, aceite, yerba y gaseosas en general. De este modo para surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy shoes, meat, sausages, rice, flour, noodles, peaches, sugar, milk, oil, sardines, and herbs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 26 years old and single. Juan has had a tire center over 4 years ago where he repairs tires, he learned this profession from his father who was dedicated to this job for a long time and from whom he learned a lot.

Juan also sells his goods in the interior of the country and in San Lorenzo where he currently rents a room and has established his business.

In the future he intends to buy several of his own machines to repair tires. Today he wishes to acquire a loan to buy a good amount of tires for new and used cars.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan tiene 26 años, es soltero. Juan tiene una gomería, donde repara las cubiertas y vende llantas y cubiertas hace 4 años, esta profesión aprendió de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo y de quien aprendió mucho.

El Sr. Juan vende también sus mercaderías en el interior del país y en San Lorenzo donde actualmente alquila un local en San Lorenzo en donde tiene su negocio fijo.

En el futuro tiene pensado comprar su propio local con varias maquinas para reparar cubiertas. Hoy desea adquirir el crédito para comprar una buena cantidad de cubiertas para autos nuevas y usadas.

loans.use: Purchase car tires

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo O., is 24 years old, has a daughter, and lives with his parents. From a very early age he's been interested in auto mechanics, and was as an apprentice at his uncle’s auto shop. After completing high school he migrated to the capital to study auto mechanics at the SNPP (National Service of Vocational Promotion). Upon graduating as a mechanic, he returned to his hometown and set up his own auto shop at home with the help of his parents. Over the years he has formed a strong customer base since he is one of very few professionals in the area.

The loan request is for the renovation of his house and to buy various tools he is lacking to provide his customers with better services.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Gerardo O., cuenta con 24 años de edad, tiene una hija, quien vive con sus padres. Desde muy joven se ha interesado en la mecánica de autos, por lo cual estuvo como aprendiz en el taller de su tío; luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios migró a la capital del país para estudiar mecánica automotriz en el SNPP (Servicio Nacional de Promoción Profesional), al recibirse como mecánico, regresó a su ciudad y montó su propio taller con la ayuda de sus padres, en su propia casa. Con el correr de los años ya tiene una clientela formada, ya que es uno de los pocos profesionales en la zona.

El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la casa y compra de algunas herramientas que le están haciendo falta para la prestación de un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Home restoration and tool purchase.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Mark R. is 30 years old, is married to Mrs. Ramona Franco, 27 years old, and has 2 children under the school age. They live in their own home which they received as part of an inheritance. To obtain the capital that enabled them to establish a small store in 2003, they had to travel abroad and work arduously for two years. Once they returned they started their own businesses by selling staples like sugar, herbs, flour, biscuits, etc. It is now one of the best stocked stores in their neighborhood with well-established customers. The amount requested is for the purchase of sugar and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Marcos R. de 30 años de edad, casado con la Sra. Ramona Franco, de 27 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos menores en edad escolar. Viven en casa propia que recibieron como herencia. Para conseguir capital de trabajo que les permitiera montar una pequeña despensa en el 2003 tuvieron que viajar al exterior y trabajar duramente por dos años. Una vez de retorno iniciaron su propio negocio con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, yerba, harina, galleta, etc. En la actualidad es una de las despensas mejor surtidas del lugar con clientela bien formada. El monto solicitado es para la compra de azúcar y arroz.

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria P. is 43 years old, and is married to Mr. Sixto Reyes who is 46 years old, they have 4 children, 2 of them are older in age and the youngest is in elementary school. Her business is the sale of milk and its by-products which she began 6 years ago with the purchase of 3 cows. Maria tells us that this activity was not sufficient to bear the expenses of her children, so they decided to open a small store with the help of her father who gave her a loan. Today the business is managed by her husband who then provides for the household and children’s expenses. This loan will be earmarked to purchase feed for their farm animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria P. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Sixto Reyes de 46 años, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor está cursando la primaria. Su actividad es la venta de leche y sus derivados la cual la inicio hace 6 años con la compra de 3 vacas. Maria nos cuenta que con esta actividad no fue suficiente para sobrellevar los gastos de los chicos, así fue que decidieron abrir una despensa con la ayuda de su padre quién le otorgo un préstamo, esta actividad hoy día es manejada por su esposo quien así aporta para los gastos de la casa y los gastos de los chicos. Este préstamo será destinado la compra de balanceados.

loans.use: Purchase feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 24 years old and married with a 1 year old son; she sells clothing and shoes, in addition she sells silver jewelry.

She’s had the business for more than 4 years and has an established base of loyal customers some of whom place orders in advance; her main shoe and clothing supplier is located in the capital of Asunción and another city to the east, with whom she has operated for more than 3 years.

Olga says that about 1 year ago she incorporated the sale of silver jewelry, this activity enabled her to have an extra income, allowing her to help her husband with family commitments, and also to cover the cost of her son’s education.

Of the loans she received from the Paraguayan Foundation she invested a part in buying clothes for the autumn and winter seasons, and the other part to purchase casual and sports shoes. The capital she received enabled her to have a supply of merchandise and to expedite orders for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga tiene 24 años está casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y zapatos, además como actividad adicional vende joyas de plata.

El negocio lo tiene desde hace mas de 4 años y posee clientela fija a quienes en algunos casos le vende sobre pedido, su proveedor principal de zapatos y ropas se encuentra en la capital Asunción y otra en Ciudad del Este, con quienes ya opera desde hace mas de 3 años.

Comenta Olga que hace aproximadamente 1 años incorporo a su negocio la venta de joyas de plata, esta actividad le permitio tener un ingreso adicional, con lo que le permite ayudar a su marido a poder hacer frente a los compromisos de la familia, como asi también cubrir los gastos de la educación de su hijo.

De los préstamos que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya lo invirtió una parte en la compra de ropas de temporada de otoño e invierno, y la otra parte en la compra de zapatos y calzados deportivos, el capital que recibio le permitio surtir mas su negocio y asi poder evacuar los pedidos de su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children, men and women, including shoes and silver jewelry, etc.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The La Esperanza (“Hope”) Committee is based in Marketalia. Marketalia is a settlement in San Lorenzo, an area where a large number of homeless and landless people gathered and, following a mass protest, forced the government to purchase and allocate it to them.

The committee is managed by several women who are experienced in organisational matters. One of these women is Maria Rosa D., affectionately known as Ña Michi, meaning “Little Lady” due to her small stature.Ña Michi is a hard-working woman who starts work at four in the morning every day, collecting and selling recyclable items made from plastic, copper and similar materials to mainly large businesses, which are the only ones with recycling facilities.

This loan will be divided equally amongst the members of the committee and each member will use her share in her particular area of activity. Some, for example, will purchase ingredients such as noodles, rice, beans, meat, milk, etc. to sell from their grocery stalls. One of the women will use the loan to purchase a massage table; others will use the loan to buy cosmetics, lotions, perfumes, and clothing for sale to their customers. However, because of her age, Ña Michi no longer has the strength to push her heavy cart full of scrap items every day. So she will use her share to buy and sell second-hand clothes.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité La Esperanza, es de la zona de Marketalia. Marketalia es un asentamiento ubicado en San Lorenzo en donde habitan una gran cantidad de personas que no tenían anteriormente techo ni tierras donde vivir y luego de una manifestación masiva, ellos ocuparon ese lugar en donde actualmente viven y que el estado compro las tierras para dárselas a ellos.

Todas retiran G. 300.000 cada una. Son muy organizadas ya que algunas señoras que conforman el comité poseen experiencia en trabajos de grupo. Una de las líderes es la señora María Rosa Domínguez a quien cariñosamente la llaman Ña Michí, que significa señora chiquita en el idioma Guaraní, por ser ella muy pequeña de estatura.

Ña Michi es muy trabajadora, todos los días empieza su jornada a las cuatro de la mañana. Ella se dedica a la recolección y venta de artículos reciclables, las empresas grandes son sus principales clientes ya que son ellos los que compran elementos de plástico, cobre y chatarra para reciclar. Ella cuenta que por su edad ya no tiene fuerzas para recorrer las calles empujando su carro que todos los días lo llena y es muy pesado, por lo que ella utilizará el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropas usadas para dedicarse a la venta de estos.

Las demás señoras destinarán sus créditos a la compra de productos como, fideos, arroz, poroto, carne, leche entre otros para la venta en sus despensas y kioscos, otra de la señoras desea adquirir una cama para masajes y otras comprarán cosméticos, cremas, perfumes ropas y lencería.

loans.use: Purchase of various grocery and consumer products by individual group members to sell to their customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of leather material for making leather jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one 100 lbs. pig and a side of beef.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
This microentrepreneur Maribel M. B. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 38 years old, married to Mr. Alfred Castillo, she has two young children. With the income from her business, Mrs. M. pays her children's educational expenses. Mrs. M. has sold cheese, cream, curd, and eggs for more than eight years. Her customers include passers-by who prefer her because she offers a variety of milk products. This is the second loan for this microentrepreneur. It is worth noting that the products she offers are in high demand by her customers. Currently, she needs to buy 300kg of cheese at $120/kg, 3 cans of cream at $32/can, 50 packages of cuajada (dry curd cheese) at $0.80/package and 1 box of eggs at $4.00/box. With this investment, she will be able to satisfy increasing customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Maribel M. B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alfredo Castillo, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, con el ingreso del negocio la Sra. M. paga los gastos de educación de su hijo. La Sra. M. vende queso, crema, cuajada y huevo por más de 8 años, teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos lácteos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 3 quintales de queso a $ 120.00 dólares el quintal, 3 bidones de crema a $32.00 dólares el bidón, 50 pares de cuajada a $0.80 centavos el par y 1 cajilla de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares la cajilla, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, cream, cuajada, (dry curd cheese), and eggs.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 41.67 dólares
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marnia Fermina

texts.es:
The microentrepreneur Marnia Fermina B. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 32 years old and a single mother of 4 young children. With the income from her business, Mrs. B. pays her children's food and education expenses. Mrs. B. owns a butcher store where she has sold pork and beef for more than six years. Her customers include cafeteria owners and passers-by who prefer her because she offers a variety of meats. This is the second loan for this microentrepreneur. It's worth noting that the products she offers are in great demand. Currently, she needs to buy 280 pounds of beef at $1.00/pound and 400 pounds of pork at $0.55/pound. With this investment, she will be able to satisfy increasing customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Marnia Fermina B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos menores de edad, con el ingreso del negocio la Sra. B. paga los gastos de educación, alimentación de sus hijos. La Sra. B. es propietaria de una carnicería donde vende carne de cerdo y de res por más de 6 años, teniendo como clientes a los propietarios de comedores y transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de carnes. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar:280 libras de carne de res a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 400 libras de carne de cerdo a $ 0.55 centavos dólar la libra, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase beef and pork.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 41.67 dólares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seeds, plants and fertiliser

loans.name: Marlín Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Marlín del Socorro N. S. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 32 years old and the single mother of one young son who is in primary school. For more than two years, Mrs. N. has owned a convenience store. Her customers are neighborhood residents and they prefer her store because she offers a variety of products (cereals, juices, soups, soft drinks, natural soft drinks, among other things). Since this is her only business, it's worth noting that the products she offers are in great demand by the population. Mrs. Navarros needs to purchase: 200kg of sugar at $32.00/kg, 2 cans of oil at $46.00/can, 6 boxes of laundry detergent at $12.00/box, 4 large packages of toilet paper at $10.00/package and 1 large package of dishwashing liquid at $8.00/package. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings and satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Marlín del Socorro N. S. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo menor de edad, quien cursa estudios primarios. La Sra. N. es propietaria de una pulpería por más de 2 años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas), siendo este negocio su único ingreso, cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. La Sra. N. necesita comprar: 2 quintal de arroz a $ 62.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 32.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 46.00 dólares el bidón, 6 cajas de Jabón para lavar ropa a $ 12.00 dólares cada caja, 4 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 10.00 dólares el bolsón y 1 bolsón de detergente a $ 8.00 dólares el bolsón, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, laundry detergent, toilet paper, and dishwashing liquid.

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
Naida is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is in her final year of studies to become a qualified teacher. Nonetheless, she has been working as a teacher for the last two years. In addition, for the last four years, Naida has been selling clothing and perfumes to supplement her income, an activity which has been quite successful. As a result, Naida has been able to pay for her studies and to assist her parents in completing the construction of the house in which they all live. In the longer term, she plans to open a small local clothing and perfume retail store.

This loan is for the purchase of additional stock of clothing and perfumes to meet the recent increase in demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Naida tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres, y esta cursando el último año de la carrera para ser profesora. Aún así, ella ya ha empezado a ejercer la docencia desde hace dos años, y también se dedica a la venta de ropas y perfumes en cuotas a todo tipo de clientes para así poder aumentar sus ingresos. Esta actividad la realiza hace ya cuatro años y cuenta que hasta ahora siempre le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas.

Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo terminar de construir la vivienda donde vive actualmente con su mamá y también es capaz de solventar sus gastos en la universidad.

En el futuro tiene pensado abrir un local para la venta de sus productos. Ella desea retirar un crédito para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de ropas y perfumes, ya que ha aumentado en estos últimos meses sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and items of clothing such as T-shirts, dresses, jackets, pants, and skirts to sell

loans.name: Comité Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
The group consists of sixteen working female members in the Sagrado Corazon D. Jesus neighbourhood of the city of Caacupe. Most of the women are engaged in the making and selling of potato chips as street vendors. The group is in the eighth round of funding by the Mujeres Emprendedoras (“Women Entrepreneurs”) programme and is one of the very few groups that has the unusual characteristic of purchasing ingredients for their business in bulk, thus obtaining a lower price from their suppliers for their purchases. Each member has been granted a line of credit of approximately $250.

The group was established in the home of one of the members and meets regularly in the early hours of the morning before work begins. A strong sense of comraderie has developed amongst the group members as a result of their collective activities such as organising raffles and preparing food for fairs to assist two of the members who had become ill and unable to work.

Group members appreciate the opportunity offered to them by Fundación Paraguaya in the form of a line of credit that provides them with working capital and enables them to negotiate a lower price from their suppliers, thus increasing their profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité está integrado por 16 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Sagrado Corazón D. Jesús D. la ciudad D. Caacupé, la gran mayoria D. las señoras se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. chipas en forma ambulante, ellas están actualmente en el 8to ciclo del programa comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, y tiene una caracteristica muy peculiar que es uno D. los pocos comités que en el momento D. realizar las compras para su negocio, lo hacen todas juntas, con el objetivo D. obtener un menor precio debido a que compran en cantidad y asi obtienen precio D. mayorista. Cada una D. las señoras estan manejando una linea D. crédito promedio D. gs. 1.000.000 (~$250).

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa D. la señora Sandra F., y la misma se realizaba a primeras horas D. la mañana ya que todas debian empezar con sus actividades laborales a primera horas D. la mañana, no obstante siempre son muy puntuales. La señora Concepción Castro, manifiesta que éste grupo D. mujeres tiene un alto sentido D. solidaridad ya que en algunos casos tuvieron que realizar actividades, como ferias D. comidas , rifas, para obtener recursos y asi ayudar a dos integrantes del comités quienes tenian problemas en su salud.

Las señoras agradecen a Fundación Paraguaya por otorgales esta oportunidad D. acceder a una línea D. crédito que le permite tener un capital D. trabajo y asi poder mejorar el precio en la compra D. sus materias primas ya que esto inciD. directamente con el precio D. venta D. sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, flour, as well as milk, biscuits, drinks in general, etc.

loans.name: Yorda Navija

texts.es:
Microentreprenuer Yorda Navija R. A. is from the city of Bluefields, 31 years old, and the mother of an 8 month old.  For the past two years, she has sold rings, bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and silver jewelry sets to the women who work at the governmental and non-governmental institutions.  They prefer her because she offers a variety of products.  This Mrs. R.'s only business.  Currently, this microentrepreneur needs:  22 units of rings at $15.00/unit, 10 units of bracelets at $18.00/unit, and 2 silver jewelry sets at $32.50/set.  With this investment, she will be able to supply the items in demand and increase her earnings.  

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Yorda Navija R. A. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 niño de 8 meses. La microempresaria  vende hace 2 años anillos, pulseras, aretes, collares y juegos de plata, teniendo como clientes a las mujeres que trabajan en instituciones no gubernamentales y gubernamentales que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. Cabe mencionar que el único ingreso de la Sra. R. es el de su negocio. En estos momentos la microempresaria necesita comprar: 22 unidades de anillos a $ 15.00 dólares la unidad, 10 unidades de pulseras a $ 18.00 dólares la unidad  y  2 juegos de plata a $ 32.50 dólares el juego, con esta inversión podrá abastecer la demanda  y aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To purchase rings, bracelets, and silver jewelry sets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina B. had a pants-making business for about a year and a half before beginning the loan process with Esperanza. She had one sewing machine and was hardly making any money. Even with the business, both she and her husband had to work second jobs to be able to proviD. for their four children. With her first loan of about US$ 200 she was able to buy enough fabric to begin making shirts as well as pants.

Her second loan consisted of almost US$ 600 and with it, she was able to buy more machines and more fabric to produce more shirts and pants faster. With her third loan of over US$ 1,000 she has been able to hire three workers and buy more machines.

As of now she has three workers apart from family members and a total of five machines. Her business is thriving and neither she nor her husband needs to work outsiD. of their business. With the money they have earned from their business, they have maD. many improvements to their house, and they have been able to buy a clothes washing machine. They are also saving as much as they can so that they will be able to build a second floor on their house and be able to put the business up on the second floor.

As of now the work center is in the kitchen. Because they must share the space of the kitchen to work, production is greatly reduced, as well as living space. Florentina's business has grown rapidly and is a great example of how well these loans work, however, she still has lots of room to grow and improve.

loans.use: build a second floor onto her house and purchase more fabric for clothes production

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
This group was formed over a year ago and is in the third round of funding by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (“Women Entrepreneurs Committee”) programme that has established the Fundación Paraguaya. Members are based in the Reducto neighbourhood of the city of San Lorenzo and are engaged in a variety of activities such as selling clothes, food, and natural remedies, either from home or door to door. The group is a stable group and there is solidarity and co-operation amongst its members. They ensure repayments are made on time and whenever a member becomes ill, others, through fundraising activities, come to her assistance. They have managed to save around $250, which they have invested in a local co-operative.

This latest round of financing is a testimony to the women’s strong desire to improve their economic conditions and self-esteem through performing key activities and mutual assistance. This is an important process leading to the strengthening of the bonds within Paraguayan families.

In accordance with the business activities of members, this loan is to purchase meat, cheese, vegetables, children and adult clothes, ice cream, soft drinks and beer. They also wish to diversify into mail-order business selling cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité LA ESPERANZA se formó hace ya más de un año, son un grupo que esta en el tercer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas son vecinas del barrio llamado Reducto en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.

Las señoras se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades entre ellas algunas tienen su negocio en su casa como despensas, las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios naturales y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.

Como grupo es un comité estable y responsable que paga sus cuotas con puntualidad y dentro del grupo son solidarias y trabajadoras, ellas ya poseen un ahorro de G.1.070.000, que lo depositan en una Cooperativa de la zona. Además realizan actividades en conjunto como rifas y venta de comidas típicas para lograr un fondo de caja de auxilio para casos en que alguien se enferme, o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

En este ciclo se nota la dedicación de las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo de su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo. Y un punto muy importante el fortalecimiento de los hogares paraguayos.

De acuerdo a las actividades de las señoras destinarán los fondos del crédito para la compra de mercaderías; en caso de las que poseen despensas compra de carne, queso, verduras. En el caso de las vendedoras de ropas comprarán ropas para adultos y niños, también en el caso de las señoras de venta de comida pretenden invertir en otros ramos como venta de productos de cosméticos por catalogo. Además algunas desean comprar helados y bebidas varias como gaseosas, cervezas, jugos, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Comité Santa Lucia I Group

texts.es:
The committee is made up of 15 working women from the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. All of the women are small businesswomen. The group is currently in the ninth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] program. Each group member receives on average about $300.

The committee started thanks to Hilda M.’s leadership skills. Hilda heard that the Fundación had an education program designed exclusively for working women. After that, working with other women from the neighborhood, she invited other working women from the neighborhood and in no time was holding the first meetings to appoint Santa Lucia committee members. The committee currently is developing a campaign to clean up sidewalks and vacant lots and has the support of the city government. The goal of the campaign is to prevent the spread of any kind of disease that can put the women’s families and children at risk.

Hilda would like to thank the Fundación Paraguaya for admitting her to the group and be part of the program. The women are learning a lot and feel very proud to be members of a group of such hard-working women who always are united. Each week they organize activities with the goal of increasing the group’s savings, which are in turn used to help members who are having problems.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas comerciantes, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 9 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y las misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 1.213.333 por cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a la capacidad de liderazgo de la señora Hilda M., quién se enteró que la Fundación tenía un programa educativo destinado exclusivamente para mujeres trabajadoras, y de ahi en mas conjuntamente con otras vecinas del barrio invitó a sus demás colegas trabajadoras del barrio y en corto tiempo ya se inicio las primeras reuniones dónde se conformó el comité Santa Lucia. El comité actualmente se encuentra desarrollando un proyecto de limpieza de veredas, patios baldios, con la ayuda de la municipalidad de la ciudad, pues el objetivo es la prevenir la proliferación de algún tipo de plaga que pueda poner en peligro la salud de sus hijos y de toda su familia.

La señora Hilda, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya porque le admitio a su grupo a ser parte de este programa, dónde están aprendiendo muchisimo, además se siente muy orgullosa de ser parte integrante de un grupo de señoras muy trabajadoras que siempre estan muy unidas y cada semana realizan actividades con la finalidad de ir aumentando su ahorro interno, como así también los ingresos son utilizados para ayudar a las integrantes que tengan algún tipo de problemas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making traditional Paraguayan bread, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as small grocery store merchandise such as sugar, meat, tea, flour, milk, charcoal and all types of drinks

loans.name: La Salvacion Group

texts.en: Elias J., 70, is the father of 6, aged 19, 19, 28, 30, 32, and 33.  Though he is supporting only two of them, he still struggles since he is a single father.  With his first Esperanza Bank of Hope loan, Elias is starting a business distributing goods like crackers, gum, and mints, but hopes to open his own store with future loans.  For now though, his main focus is on maintaining a stable income.  Elias is a group leader in his Bank of Hope, La Salvacion ("The Salvation").

loans.use: Goods distribution

loans.name: Uwimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Ruhengeri in Rwanda! V. is 28 years old and is married with three children and four adopted orphans from the 1994 genocide.

In 2003, V. started her business of selling agricultural produce in different local markets in the area. V. has a plan of expanding her business to other local markets in the country. She is requesting a loan of 500,890 RWF to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Expand her business to other local markets

loans.name: Comite Mujeres Alegre Group

texts.es:
The committee is made up of 15 working women from the town of Cabañas de Caacupé. Most of these women make and sell chipas [traditional Paraguayan cheese bread]. Currently the group is in the eighth cycle of the program. Establishing the group and appointing officers was made possible by Maria G.’s hard work. Since the beginning she has served as coordinator and leader of the group and organized the first committee meetings in her home.

Of the 15 women, 10 sell chipas; the others are despensa (small grocery store) owners, and a few also sell clothing. All of the women live in the Cabañas area in the city of Caacupé. One of the best attributes of this committee is the level of interest in and compliance with the policies and procedures of the women’s group. This is demonstrated by the group’s on-time payments. In addition, the group has financial savings because of the activities the women organize every weekend, such as a food festivals, raffles, and athletic tournaments, among others. Each member receives on average a $165, which they invest in making the products described above.

The women of the committee would like to thank the Fundación Paraguaya board of directors for keeping in mind honest, hard-working people who do not receive any support from the government.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía (pueblo) Cabañas de Caacupé, la gran mayoria se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo está en su 8vo. ciclo del programa comité de mujeres y sus inicios y su conformación se debio a la gran colaboración que brindo la señora Maria G., quien desde el inicio lleva la coordinación y liderazgo del grupo, en su domicilio se realizó las primeras reuniones del comité.

De las 15 señoras, 10 se dedican a la venta de chipas, y las demás son comerciantes despenseras y algunas venden ropas, todas son vecinas de la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caaupé, una de las virtudes de este comité es el interès y el cumplimiento por las normas y el reglamento del programa de comité de mujeres emprendoras, y esta demostrado por su buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas, además poseen un ahorro gracias a las actividades que realizan cada fin de semana como ser feria de comidas, rifas, torneos deportivos, entre otras actividades. Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 660.00 (~$165) y lo invierten para la produción de sus productos descriptos más arriba.

Las señoras integrantes del comité, agradecen a los directivos de la Fundación Paraguaya por acordarse de la gente humilde y trabajadora que no reciben apoyo del gobierno.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make traditional Paraguayan bread such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as clothing for sale, such as shorts, tee shirts, socks, and shirts for juniors, children and adults, etc.

loans.name: Ngirimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Ruhengeri in Rwanda! D. is 48 years old, married with 6 children and one adopted orphan whose parents died in the 1994 Genocide.

In 2002, D. started her business of selling used clothes and selling agricultural produce like beans, sorghum, cassava flour potatoes, cabbage etc in different markets in Ruhengeri town . She is employing one person to help her run the business. D. wants to expand her business to different markets in Northern province of Rwanda.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Rutagengwa

texts.en:
Mr. Rutagengwa is an orphan. His parents were killed during the genocide in 1994. He now has four children in his charge. Rutagengwa joined Vision Finance in 2005.

With his first loan of 20,000 RWF, he continued selling clothes in Nyabugogo Market. He is now able to pay school fees for his young brothers. He is now requesting 500,890 RWF. It is his seventh loan.

loans.use: To increase his business capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio L. T. is a married man with four children who lives in Los Alcarrizos. Before beginning the loan process with Esperanza Internacional, Antonio had a little convenience store in the patio space of his house. Despite having a business, he was still struggling to support his family. After only two loans, of 10,000 and 20,000 pesos respectively, Antonio estimates that his convenience store has grown by about 40%.

With the income that he has generated from his convenience store, Antonio has been able to provide for his family and even buy his own motorcycle. Despite the rapid growth of this business, Antonio still has many things that he would like to accomplish.

Right now he is saving money to extend his house by walling in the patio that contains his convenience store with concrete. At present, the wall consists of a metal gate, which although still difficult to penetrate, is easier to enter than a concrete wall. Because there is so much theft in the neighborhood, Antonio wants to make sure that a robbery does not happen to him.

The money he receives from his next loan will mostly go towards expanding his business with more merchandise. He would particularly like to provide telephone cards for his customers. In the long run, once he has finally made his convenience store profitable enough, Antonio would like to move his convenience store out of his house and into its own building.

loans.use: purchase of more merchandise, e.g. telephone cards, and a new showcase for his products

loans.name: Roberto Ado

texts.es:
Roberto is 52 years of age. He lives with his wife, his 28 year-old daughter who is studying at the university of Tarma, and his little four year-old granddaughter.

Together with his wife, they are dedicated to raising small animals, especially guinea pigs, which are very profitable because they sell them in the capital where their price is higher. They have been doing this for more than three years and, thanks to his wife, who risked going to the capital to sell, they have more orders. She travels fortnightly. What he likes about this business is that it gives him the opportunity to spend time working in a metal shop where he helps. Nevertheless, raising animals demands an improvement in the breed, which is expensive. Roberto works so that he can help pay for his daughter's education, as well as that of his granddaughter, and he pushes every day to increase his orders.

The money that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pure-breed animals in order to improve the quality of his guinea pigs, of which he has 120. He not only wishes to increase the quantity of animals, but he also hopes to have a small metal shop in the future where he may work.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Roberto, tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y su hija de 28 años quien cursa estudios superiores en la universidad de Tarma y su pequeña nieta de 4 años. Junto a su esposa, se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, sobre todo de cuy, los cuales son muy rentables, porque los vende en la capital donde sus precios se elevan. Esta actividad la realiza por más de 3 años y gracias a su esposa, quien se arriesgó a ir a la capital para vender es donde tienen mayores pedidos, ella viaja quincenalmente.Lo que le agrada de esta actividad, es que le da tiempo para trabajar algunas horas en un taller de carpintería metálica, donde colabora. Sin embargo, la crianza de animales demanda la mejora de la raza, lo cual es costoso. Roberto trabaja para solventar los estudios de su hija y sobre todo el de su nieta de 4 años, quien lo impulsa día tras día para incrementar sus pedidos. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de animales de raza, para mejorar la calidad de sus cuyes que hasta ahora son 120, y no tan solo espera incrementar la cantidad sus animales, sino que en el futuro pueda tener un pequeño taller de metálica en donde pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase pure-breed animals in order to improve the quality of his guinea pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I.  is an orphan. Almost all of her family was killed in 1994, during the genocide.

She began  selling boiled  eggs with 2000 Rwf (less than US$ 4) as capital. When she reached 50,000 Rwf (about US$ 90),
she joined Nyabugogo market and is now selling dresses.
Ms. I.  has three  children  in charge,  one in secondary school and two in primary school.

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is 26 years old, a single mother and lives in a rented house along with her three children, who are 12, 7 and 2 years old.

She sells beauty products, something she has been doing for the past 4 years and because of which, has developed certain abilities for selling. She works almost the entire day and not a moment goes by when she is not selling her products, wherever she is. She likes this work because there are no fixed working hours and thanks to this, she can do other activities such as helping out at a bakery. The only difficulty for her is that she needs to find clients who are able to pay the debts they incur with her when they order products.

Her efforts are motivated by her three children who need her support; the fact that she does not have a husband makes this responsibility more difficult.

María requests a loan to buy products, which sellers are able to get at lower prices, so that she can meet her customers´ requests and have some product on hand, and also so she can open up a small store for selling her products from home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

María tiene 26 años, es madre soltera y vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus tres hijos de 12, 7 y el último de tan solo 2 años.

Ella trabaja en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, por ello ha logrado tener práctica y desarrollar ciertas habilidades para ofrecer sus productos, prácticamente trabaja toma todo el día, no hay momento que no ofrezca sus productos en los diversos lugares que se encuentra, lo cual le agrada, porque no tiene horario, y gracias a ello puede dedicarse a otras actividades como ayudante de panadería. La única dificultad para ella, es tener que captar clientes con capacidad de pago, para que se endeude con sus pedido.

El motor de su esfuerzo son sus tres hijos quienes necesitan de su madre para poder desarrollarse, el no contar con una pareja hace difícil esta responsabilidad.

María solicita el préstamo para adquirir productos en promoción que son ofrecidos a las vendedoras a menores precios, lo que es un apoyo para atender los requerimientos de sus clientes y tener en stock algunos productos, y lograr tener en su domicilio una pequeña tienda de estos productos.

loans.use: Buy products wholesale in order to have supplies available to her customers and open a store in her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. N. was born in 1951. She is married and  she has six children and three orphans to care for.
Four among them are in secondary school and three in primary school.
She sells hardware in Gakinjiro  market.
She began her activity with 25,000 Rwf (about US$ 45) and now she has 300,000 Rwf (about US$ 550) as capital.

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Muvunyi

texts.en:
Mr. Muvunyi V.  was born in 1972 and he is married. He has two childen and three orphans. He sells goats in various markets. 
Four of the children are still in primary school, and one orphan is in secondary school.
This is his first loan and he want to increase the number of goats he sells.

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Comité Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
This committee is made up of 17 working women from the Costa Alegre de Cabañas neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. Most of the women make and sell chipas [traditional Paraguayan cheese bread]. The committee is currently in the fifth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] program, which provides average loans of about $125 to each of its members.

The committee was established with the first meetings in Maria Cirina S.’s house. Maria took charge of bringing the women together for meetings to appoint members of the group. One of the characteristics of this group is its on-time installment payments and its savings. The committee’s current goal is to meet with other women in the neighborhood to clean the sidewalks and streets, as well as plant trees on the block, all with their children’s care and wellbeing in mind.

Maria is very happy and proud to be an integral part of a group of women with honest goals such as helping to improve the quality of life in their community by doing community work. For example, they have organized athletic activities, musical contests and a San Juan party, with the objective of raising funds to increase their savings. In so doing, the group has planned for any unexpected event that might occur and thus provided the greatest assurance that late payments will not occur.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 17 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Costa Alegre de Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, la gran mayoría son fabricantes y vendedoras de chipas, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 5 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 494.000 (~$125) para cada integrantes.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Maria Cirina S., quién fue la encargada de convocar a las señoras para las reuniones de conformación del grupo y una de las caracteristica de este comités es la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y sus ahorros. El comité actualmente es tiene como objetivo la de reunirse con las demás señoras del barrio para limpiar las veredas, la calle, arbolarizar la cuadra dónde viven, todo pensando en el cuidado y bienestar de sus hijos.

La señora Maria, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa de ser parte integrante de un grupo de señoras con finalidades nobles como la de ayudar a mejorar el nivel de vida de su comunidad a través de trabajos comunitarios, entre ella destaca que tuvieron que realizar actividades deportivas, concursos musicales y fiesta de San Juan, con el objetivo de recaudar fondos para capitalizar sus ahorros y asi preveer cualquier contingencia que pueda ocurrir en un futuro y por ende evitar al máximo algún tipo de atrasos en sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making traditional Paraguayan bread, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as merchandise for sale, such as sugar, meat, tea, flour, milk, charcoal and all types of drinks

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina R. M. is a 29-year-old single mother of two school-age children. She is the only one of her siblings who lives with her parents, seeing her brothers and sisters all are married and working in Argentina.

When she was very young, Agustina began helping her mother weave traditional bedspreads, which they then sold in the area. As they didn’t make a lot of money doing this, they started traveling to other areas, such as Asunción, where they acquired a lot of clients and became more profitable. Because of Agustina’s work, she has been able to buy a motorbike, which she uses to make her sales. She also saved enough to build her own house, which she desired for her children for a long time, especially after their father left them.

In addition to the bedspreads, Agustina sells other women’s hand-made crafts to make more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise, such as hammocks, blankets, sashes and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson
