Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales en la plaza de Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Ilave en Jirón Sucre s/n, con los créditos anteriores amplió su negocio de venta de hierbas y con las ganancias compró ganado vacuno. Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00, nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará con la tercera parte hierbas y con el resto una vaca pequeña. La venta de hierbas medicinales aprendió de su madre quien era naturista, ella desde los 12 años se dedicaba ayudar a su madre, con la experiencia que tuvo emprendió su propio negocio hace 15 años, por ello es su actividad principal y la crianza de ganado lo realiza su esposo en la Parcialidad Maquera. Ella se encuentra muy contenta y feliz; ya que en el hogar tienen más ingresos económicos y además incrementó su mercadería de hierbas. Guillermina tiene 37 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta cuarto de primaria, es madre de tres hijos y es casada. Su perspectiva futura es tener Casa Naturista en la ciudad de Ilave, sus hijos sean algún día profesionales y continuar trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of herbs and purchase of one cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela belongs to Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua in the Zepita district, Chucuito province, Puno region, Peru. She is 30 years old, is married and has a son to support. She went to school until her third year of high school. She prepares quinua and cañihua juice, starting work at 3:30 in the morning and working until 9:00 p.m. from Monday to Saturday selling her products at the Desaguadero district terminal or to motorists. With previous loans, she has increased her capital. With this 500 nuevo sol loan, which she will repay in four months, Graciela will buy three sacks of sugar and two sacks of cornstarch for preparing juice. She is happy with her business and is already increasing her capital and income. Four years ago, Graciela got started with her business thanks to her friend Modesta, who taught her how to prepare juices, and Manuela Ramos, who gave her credit. Her dreams are to have a grocery store in Desaguadero and see her son become a police officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela pertenece al Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua del distrito de Zepita, Provincia Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. Tiene 30 años de edad, casada y tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su estudió fue hasta tercero de secundaria. Ella se dedica al preparado de jugo de quinua y cañihua, para preparar se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. y descansa a las 9:00 p.m., esto vende en el distrito de Desaguadero en el Terminal zonal o paradero de los carros de lunes a sábado. Con los anteriores créditos logró incrementar su capital. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 3 sacos de azúcar y 2 bolsas de maicena para el preparado de jugos. Ella esta contenta con su negocio, ya que está incrementando su capital y ingresos económicos. Graciela, hace cuatro años se dedica a este negocio, gracias a que su amiga Modesta le enseñó a preparar jugos y además agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo con el crédito. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Desaguadero y su hijo sea policía.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sugar and cornstarch

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Eugenia A. actively participated in the creation of the current group. She lives in zone B° Sto. Tomas – Pte Franco, and she contacted her neighbors and friends in order to create the group in the zone. The group is made up of 18 women from the same zone. They participate in businesses by selling clothing, foodstuffs, cosmetics, household items and other basic needs. The women took a loan of 300.000 C/U (Paraguayan currency). They will use this credit to buy clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, and other items in other to sell them.

About Group Loans In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Learn more

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité participo activamente la señora Eugenia A., ella vive en la zona del B° Sto. Tomas – Pte Franco, la misma contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. El comité esta constituido por 18 señoras, todas de la misma zona, las señoras tienen actividades como venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos, despensa y otros. Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000 C/U. Ellas Utilizan el crédito para la compra de ropas, cosméticos, telas, artículo de primera necesidad y otros para su posterior venta.

loans.use: To buy clothing, material, cosmetics, oil, flour, basic need products and others.

loans.name: Mercedes Floriza

texts.es:
Mercedes, 35, is an enterprising, hard-working woman with a lot of energy. She tends pasture land to grow feed for the animals that she fattens for market. She also sells grass from the pasture to earn extra income. She grows and sells potatoes, oca, mashua and olluco (oca, mashua and olluco are Andean tuber crops) on land that she acquired recently. She gets up early every day to oversee her crops with special care for anything that might have to be harvested soon. She lives and breathes on the hope that all of her children will finish school; it's what spurs her on each day. The loan that she's applied for will be invested in her next crop and to set up a fish farm (for raising fish and especially trout) that she's planning.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 35 años y todas las energías necesarias para trabajar, cultiva pastos para la alimentación de sus animales, que engorda y luego vende en las ferias de su localidad, también aprovecha en vender estos pastos para generan un adicional. Cultiva y vende papa, oca, mashua y olluco en unas tierras que adquirió recientemente.Diariamente se levanta temprano para velar por sus tierras de cultivo, aquellas que están próximas a cosechar. Que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, es lo que le alienta cada día para continuar.El préstamo que solicita por este medio es para invertirlo en la siembra de sus campos de cultivo, y para iniciar una piscigranja (criadero de peces, en especial de la trucha) para la cual se está proyectando.

loans.use: Capital for farming and fish-farming businesses.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Marlene married Mr. Dionosio, they have two small children. Thanks to her husbands support she started her business, which has been running for 3 years and is able to compete with others in the zone in which she does business. She wants to invest the loan in the wholesale purchase of merchandise since she has built a salon in the front part of her home. Since this investment cost a lot, she needs some money to better stock her store. 1. As a mother she hopes for the best for her children, whether it be to feed them, educate, dress them and other needs and to be able to fulfill all her wishes as a mother, she states that the only way to be able to this is through business and the only alternative for growth is credit. They are entrepreneurial families and are improving their standard of living, and they are committed to completely fulfill their obligations. Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marlene se casó con el señor Dionisio, tienen dos hijos pequeños. Ella empezó su negocio gracias al apoyo de su marido, su negocio tiene 3 años de antigüedad y esta a la altura de la competencia de la zona en donde opera. El crédito solicitado quiere invertir en la compra de mayor volumen de mercaderías ya que construyo un salón en frente de su residencia. Como la inversión tuvo mucho costo le esta faltando un poco de capital para tener mas surtido su despensa. 1. Como toda madre ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos ya sea para dar alimentación, educación, vestimenta y otras necesidades. Y para conseguir todo los deseos de madre, Ella manifiesta que la única alternativa para poder conseguir es mediante las actividades económicas que realicen y la única alternativa de crecimiento es el crédito. Son familias emprendedoras y van aumentando su nivel de vida, además, se comprometen a cumplir a cabalidad sus compromisos.

loans.use: To buy soda, sugar, herbs and other basic needs.

loans.name: 6 De Julio Group

texts.es:
This group from the San Pedro Neighborhood was formed through another group formed in the same neighborhood. All the women participate in business; selling merchandise on the international bridge (oils, flour, sugar, detergent, pastas and other foodstuffs), also selling cosmetics, cell phones, clothing, sheets and towels. A woman works raising chickens, and other have their own businesses at home (store, hair salons, tailoring). The amount of money that each woman receives varies from 300,000 to 1,000,000 guaranies( Paraguayan currency, $75-$250), the all use the loan to buy merchandise for their current businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió por medio de otro comité formado en el mismo barrio. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas venta de mercaderias en el puente internacional (aceites, harinas, azucar, jabon en polvo, fideos y otros productos comestibles) tambien venden cosmeticos, telefonos celulares, ropas, sabanas y tohallas, Una señora tiene negocio de cria de pollos y otras negocios propios en su domicilio( despensa, peluqueria, y modista). El monto que recibe cada señora varia de 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs (~$75-$250), todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderias para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente.

loans.use: To buy eggs, oil, wine, powdered soap, sugar, pastas, rice, flour and milk products, chickens in order to raise them, clothing, lingerie, sheets for further sale

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
To form the committee, we first went to Ms. Her Melinda B., mother of three, who exclusively works selling adult clothing, because of her we were able to meet the rest of the members, who also participate in may activities to help cover their families basic needs. They are from km 8 ½ Acaray, Ka’aguy Rory. They each withdrew 300,000 guaranies. (Paraguayan currency) which was used for buying merchandise, such as clothing, foodstuffs, and other things for sale.

About Group Loans In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Learn more

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Para la formación del comité, primeramente recurrimos a la Sra. Hermelinda B., madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas exclusivamente para adultos, a través de esta señora llegamos a conocer al resto de las integrantes, quienes también realizan varias actividades para cubrir necesidades básicas de sus respectivas familias; ellas son del km 8 1⁄2 Acaray, Ka´aguy Rory. Ellas retiraron 300,000 Gs. cada una, el cual se destina a la compra de mercaderías, tales como: ropas, comestibles. y otros artículos para la venta..

loans.use: To buy clothing, sugar, oil, earrings, chains, belt buckles and other supplies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ms. Angela A. is single and 49 years old. She has lived in her own home in the Buena Vista Neighborhood for 22 years. She has two adult children, one of them lives in her home, and the other is married and lives with his family. Ms. Angela has owned her own business for the past 15 years, she has a store that has a good amount of various merchandise. She is a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for many years know, she has had many transactions with the institution and states she is very happy with them.

Ms. Angela has asked for a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store such as, flour, bread crumbs, canned good, drinks, herbs, pastas, rice, cleaning and craft supplies and others.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angela A. es soltera, tiene 49 años, vive en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Buena Vista desde hace ya 22 años.Ella tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, una de ellas vive en la misma casa y el otro ya esta casado y vive de manera independiente con su familia. La señora Angela es propietaria de su microempresa desde hace 15 años, ella posee una Despensa en donde cuenta con una buena cantidad de mercaedrias de todo tipo. Ella es cliente de la Fundacion Paraguaya desde hace varios años, ha tenido varias operaciones con la Institucion y manifiesta estar muy conforme con la misma.

La señora ha solicitado el credito para la compra de mas mercaderias para su Despensa como ser: harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas en general, yerbas, fideos, arroz, articulos de limpieza, articulos de merceria y otros.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store such as, flour, bread crumbs, canned good, drinks, herbs, pastas, rice, cleaning and craft supplies and others.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa María Belén is married and has two daughters who are 22 and 18 years old. She has a business making many household goods including curtains, sheets, towels, rugs, shirts and pant. She receives orders from people in her area and she then goes to the client’s home to take the measurements for the bedding or to match curtain colors with the walls and furniture. She thinks this individual attention is what allows her to do well. She used to sell in the market, but it’s difficult, since she has to maintain a large inventory without any guarantee of sale. Rosa began working with Fundación Paraguaya about a year ago as a part of a group loan. This is her first individual loan. She is very happy because she had difficult time securing small loans to buy material to complete large orders. She is now able to buy the material she needs and continue being successful in her business. Rosa, her 18 year-old daughter, will finish high school this year. Her 22 year-old daughter has her own Internet and video store and she has just asked for her first loan as well.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa María Belén está casada, tiene dos hijas, que actualmente tienen 22 y 18. Ella tiene un negocio de fabricación de varios artículos de la casa incluyendo cortinas, sábanas, toallas, alfombras, camisas, y pantalones. Ella recibe órdenes de individuos en su área y luego va a la casa de cada cliente para tomar las medidas de su colchón, o emparejar los colores de cortinas con la pared y muebles. Ella piensa que esta atención individual es que le permite ser acertado. Ella solía vender en el mercado, pero esto es difícil, como ella tiene que tener mucho inventario sin cualquier garantía de una venta. Rosa comenzó a trabajar con Fundación Paraguaya hace un año como la parte de un préstamo de grupo. Esto es su primer préstamo individual. Ella muy está feliz porque antes ella tenía que reunir a duras penas pequeños préstamos para comprar el material para completar órdenes grandes. Ahora ella es capaz de comprar el material que necesita y seguir el éxito de su negocio. La hija de 18 años de Rosa termina este año la secundaria. Su hija de 22 años tiene su propio negocio que controla una tienda de Internet y de vídeo, y acaba de solicitar su primer préstamo también.

loans.use: to buy material and thread

loans.name: Silma

texts.es:
Silma is a young woman with three daughters. Her partner's name is Higinio Brizuela. Silma works selling all kinds of merchandise such as sugar, noodles, oil, cheese, etc.

Silma has been working in this line of business for over two years and has her store right in her home. She had to make some modifications to the house to be able to have the store there.

The money that Silma makes in her store goes towards the cost of running her home, so she and her partner can pay for what their family needs.

Silma says that she makes a lot of sales and this is why she would like to increase the amount of merchandise she has for sale. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers in the area where she lives and works.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Silma, es una señora joven, esta acompañada con el señor Higinio Brizuela y es madre de tres nenas. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como, azúcar, fideo, arroz, aceite, queso, entre otras cosas.

Silma se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de 2 años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Ella tuvo que hacer algunas modificaciones a la casa para poder tener su propio salón comercial.

Silma, con los ingresos que consigue de su despensa aporta al mantenimiento de la casa, de esa forma con su compañero hacen frente a los gastos familiares.

Silma, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde vive y tiene su salón comercial.

loans.use: Purchase of various kinds of merchandise such as sugar, noodles, oil, herbs, rice, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel is 43, married and lives in his own home with his wife and three of their children. Two of the children have their own jobs working for different companies. Daniel grew up in the Encarnacion region and still lives in the same place where he was born. He has worked in the poorer area of Encarnacion for 15 years, where he has two stands selling merchandise and natural products. Daniel already has a strong client base that makes purchases every week and provides him with sufficient income to cover the costs of running his home and family obligations. He also sells his products from home, where his wife waits on the customers. This allows them to have another source of income for the family and allows his wife to earn income and still be able to care for the family.

Daniel is requesting this loan to purchase additional merchandise for his stands. He is requesting G/ 2,000,000 [local currency: guarani].

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Daniel tiene 43 años, es casado, vive en su casa propia con su cónyuge y tres de sus hijos de los cuales dos están trabajando por cuenta propia ya que son empleados en diferentes empresas. El cliente se crió en la zona de Encarnación y vive en el mismo lugar desde que nació. El cliente trabaja en la zona baja (un barrio de pocos recursos) de Encarnación desde hace 15 años, allí posee dos puestos de ventas de mercaderias y de productos naturales, el señor tiene ya formada una clientela que semanalmente le compran y le genera un buen ingreso como para que pueda cubrir los gastos del hogar y sus obligaciones. El señor tambien realiza ventas de sus productos en su domicilio en donde la que se encarga de atender es su señora, eso hace que se pueda tener otra fuente de ingreso en el flujo familiar y que ademas su señora pueda ayudar a generar ingresos sin descuidar la casa.

El Señor Daniel solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para surtir sus puestos. El monto que solicita es de G. 2.000.000

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: lotions, soaps, makeup, scissors, penknives, nail clippers, decorative boxes, candy, first aid items, medicinal herbs, etc.

loans.name: Waldice

texts.es:
Waldecide is 35, single and manages a chorizo business with his father. At his father's house, Waldecide and his father use an old hand-crank machine to produce sausage from local meat that they buy at the market. They do this at the beginning of the week and again on Thursdays, to get ready for the weekend. Then Waldecide and his father pack the sausages in a container that they strap to a motorbike and sell their products all over the region, both at markets and door-to-door. The majority of Paraguayans purchase sausage on Saturday, to prepare after sports games on Sunday and for family meals. This is the first time Waldecide is requesting a loan with the Fundacion Paraguay. Using the funds, he hopes to increase the variety of products that he makes and repair his familiy's van. This will make it much easier to transport and sell the chorizo. He and his father really enjoy this business and they hope to constantly increase the products they have to offer and to be able to sell them right from their house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Waldecide tiene 35 años, él es soltero y maneja un negocio de chorizo con su padre. En la casa de su padre, Waldecide y su padre usan una vieja máquina de manivela de mano para producir la salchicha de la carne local que ellos compran en el mercado. Ellos hacen esto al inicio de la semana, y luego otra vez el jueves, para prepararse para el fin de semana. Waldecide y su padre entonces embalan las salchichas en un contenedor atado con correa a la motocicleta y los venden en todas partes de la región - en mercados y puerta a puerta. La mayor parte de paraguayos compran la salchicha para el sábado, para después del partido (partes) del domingo y comidas con la familia. Esto es el primer préstamo de Waldecide con Fundación Paraguaya. Con este préstamo él espera aumentar la variedad de productos que él hace, y reparar la furgoneta de familia, que le haga más fácil transportar el chorizo para la venta. Él y su padre disfrutan de este negocio y esperan continuamente ampliar sus productos y ser capaces de venderlos directamente desde su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of meats and ingredients to make chorizo and sausage.

loans.name: Edgar Idelino

texts.es:
Mr. Edgar Idelono is the owner of San Cayetano Store. He is single and has owned his own home since he was 39. He has been working in this line of business for more than 15 years. He makes deliveries with his own truck (for which he has the proper documents of ownership) in the Coronel Bogado area and has a helper who is 23. The loan will be used for the cash purchase of merchandise such as essentials, plastic products and some clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Edgar Idelono es propietario de un Comercial”San Cayetano” , soltero con vivienda propia de 39 años de edad se dedica a este rubro hace mas de 15 años. Realiza repartos en camion propio(presenta documentos) por la zona de Coronel Bogado, es ayudado por un joven de 23 años. El crédito fue destinado para la compra al contado de mercaderias(articulos de primera necesidad, plasticos y un poco de ropas).

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona has been married for several years. She and her husband have a lovely home with their two daughters, who are in middle school. The couple decided to set up a sewing workshop after they suffered a serious traffic accident. At that time they worked selling herbs. Currently, their workshop is growing and they are doing a lot of sales. As a result, they are able to live a more peaceful life, pay for their daughters' studies and earn a decent living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Petrona esta casada desde hace varios años. Tienen un lindo hogar tranquilo con sus 2 hijas que aún están cursando el nivel medio.- La pareja tomo la decisión de montar un taller de costura después de sufrir un grave accidente de transito cundo se dedicaban a la venta de productos de herba live.- Hoy día el taller esta solidificado, tienen muy buena venta, como resultante de esta pueden llevar una vida mas sosegada, pagan el estudio de sus hijas y llevan una vida decorosa.

loans.use: Fabric purchase

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is 42 and lives with her husband of 17 years, Lino Ariste. They have three daughters, ages 16, 14 and 11. All three girls are in school and depend on their parents for economic support.

They have lived in their own home for the last 15 years, a home they were able to purchase through much hard work and sacrifice. Lino has worked for the company Algodonera for the last several years and Gladys owns an ice cream business, where she also sells beverages. In addition, she also has a small sewing workshop where she makes clothes and does embroidery.

Gladys is requesting a loan so that she can purchase a sewing machine for her workshop. The sewing machine would be extremely important to her business, as it would allow her to fill all of her orders. Gladys is requesting a loan of G 3,000,000.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gladys tiene 42 años, vive con su cónyuge que es el señor Lino Ariste desde hace 17 años y tienen tres hijas, una de 16 años, otra de 14 y la menor de 11 años. Las tres niñas estudian y dependen económicamente de la pareja.

Viven en su casa propia desde hace 15 años, la cual han podido adquirir mediante el trabajo y el sacrificio de ambos. El señor Lino es funcionario de una empresa Algodonera desde hace varios años. La señora Gladys es propietaria de una Heladería en la cual también vende bebidas. A parte de eso posee un pequeño taller de costura en donde realiza confecciones de ropa y bordados.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de una maquina de coser para su taller de costura, debido a que le es sumamente necesaria para cumplir con los pedidos. La señora Gladys solicita el monto de G 3.000.000. [Guarani, local currency].

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra is 58 years old and was married but she is currently separated. She has 10 children, all whom are of age and independent, except 3 that still live with her and also work in a company and contributing to the familly finances.

Alejandra says that she is originally from the city of Villarrica, where she once had a grocery store, but due to life circumstances she decided to migrate to Asuncion to dedicate her time to another business. That's when she started as an artisan creating vases and drinking glasses for "Terere" (a drink made from Yerba Mate). Later on she expanded and started to make gourds and thermos containers for Yerba Mater and Terere, covered in leather bearing different company brands. Today she makes many items and she sells them to her clients who mostly reside in the interior of the country.

All the funds that she is granted will be invested into the purchase of raw materials for her small business, such as: wood, leather for coverings, paints etc. And she says that with the loan she will be able to create better quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra Alejandra tiene 58 años de edad y estuvo casada , pero actualmente está separada y tiene 10 hijos todos mayores e independientes sólo 3 de ellos viven con ella y trabajan también en la empresa ayudando en la economía familiar. Doña Alejandra cuenta que es oriunda de la ciudad de Villarrica, en donde tenia una despensa , pero por cirscunstancias de la vida decidió venir a Asunción para dedicarse a otro emprendimiento , entonces empezó con la artesanía elaborando morteritos y vasos para tomar tereré, luego de a poco fue haciendo también guampas y termos para mate y tereré forrados en cueros y con logos de distintas empresas. Hoy día lo hace en cantidad y lleva a venderlos por el interior del país donde están la mayoría de sus clientes . Todo crédito que ella retira lo invierte en la compra de materia prima de su Microempresa, como ser : la madera, el cuero para el forro, las pinturas etc, y es importante dice pues mediante los préstamos puede lograr la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials:  wood, paints, and leather.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their home located in Itapua Poty. He has just finished his studies and has obtained a degree in Agricultural Engineering thanks to the work and sacrifice of his parents. His is the owner of a gym and is also the founder of the Agrarian Extension group, which has been together for two years.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase more stationary bicycles and gym equipment, as he has many clients and he needs to better equip his gym in order to give his clients better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hugo tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa propia que queda situada en Itapua Poty. El ya ha culminado sus estudios y ha obtenido el titulo de Ingeniero Agrónomo gracias al trabajo y sacrificio de sus padres. El es propietario de su gimnasio y aparte es funcionario de la Dirección de Extensión Agraria desde hace 2 años.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mas bicicletas estáticas y aparatos para su gimnasio, ya que cuenta con mucha clientela y necesita equipar más su local para poder brindarles un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase stationary bicycles and gym equipment

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.es:
Mr. Lucilio L. is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents in their home locabied in the city of Fernando de la Mora.

He has been the driver for his Taxi for 6 years but he first started out as a driver for someone else. In 2005 he purchased his own vehicle and acquired his own permit so that he could work for himself.

Lucilio is requesting a loan for the repair of the key mechanism, body and flooring of his car to improve the state of his Taxi and to provide better comfort to his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Lucilio L. tiene 26 años , es soltero y vive con sus padres en su dimicilio ubicado en la Ciudad de Fernando de la Mora. El mismo es conductor de Taxi desde hace 6 años donde empezó trabajando para otra persona pero en el año 2005 compró un vehículo propio y derecho a la parada donde estaba para poder trabajar en forma independiente. El sr. Lucilio solicita el crédito para la reparación de la chapería, pintura y el tapizado de su automovil para poder tener en mejores codiciones su taxi y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus pasajeros

loans.use: Repairs to the key mechanism and body of his vehicle (a taxi).

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.es:
Mrs Maria Evelin is 21 years old, married and has a 5 year old son, Nelson, after whom she named her food kiosk.

Maria Evelin lives in the “21 March” quarter, in the city of Villa Elisa. She cooks and sells food like sandwiches and empanadas (turnovers). She also sells drinks, candies and other basic commodity products as rice, sugar, bread and herbs.

Her main clients are her neighbors who buy daily at the kiosk. She started the business one year ago because she wanted to contribute to the family’s income and because she had some spare time. She started with a small amount of capital, only selling drinks. As the business grew, Maria Evelina and her partner invested more money and started selling more products.

Today, they request a loan because they want to keep investing in their food kiosk as the sales continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Evelin tiene 21 años, actualmente esta casada y es madre de un hijo de 5 años llamado Nelson, de ahi el nombre al negocio,

Vive en el asentamiento 21 de marzo de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. La Sra. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida rapida como empanadas, sanwiches y otros. Y tambien venta de bebidas en gral, golosinas, articulos de 1ra. Necesidad como panificados, yerba, arroz, azucar, etc.

Sus principales clientes son los vecinos de dicho asentamiento quienes a diario se surten de su negocio. Nos comento que un año atrás despues de juntarse con su actual pareja y ya que contaban con un pequeño capital (Gs. 300.000) decidieron invertir en venta de bebidas para ayudar a la economia familiar y de paso tener una actividad que la distraiga ya que su marido salía a trabajar y tenia mucho tiempo libre.

En vista a que los ingresos de la venta de bebidas ayudaron y de buena manera a su bienestar, decidieron invertir mas dinero y surtieron con mas mercaderías el negocio.

A ese nivel iba creciendo el comercio hasta que hoy necesitaron una inyeccion de capital superior para seguir invirtiendo en el kiosko. He de ahi la razon por el cual acudio a nuestra institucion.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for their food kiosk

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: La Sra Ramona L. casada de 38 años tiene dos hijos una mujer de 13 años y un varon de 18 años quienes estudian en el colegio Nacional de Zona. Barrio Unido km 36 del Distrito de Tomas Romero Pereira. Su cónyuge el Sr Mario Arzamendia Vazquez el mismo se dedica ala Agicultura cultiva soja, girasol y algodón lo cual aporta tambien a la unidad familiar. La Sra Ramona es Microempresaria propietaria de una despensa, ventas de cerdos, venta de huevos de gallinas propias, y aquila una cancha de voley que tiene. Cuenta con 3 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le genera un buen ingreso. La misma solicito un credito de 3MM a 12 meses que fue destinanado compra de mercaderias de articulos de primera necesidad como ser yerba, azucar, harina, arroz, aceite etc. la misma recomienda operar con Fundacion Paraguaya por la agilidad del crédito y la buena atencion brindada y que es una gran ayuda a los microempresarios de la Zona.
texts.en:
Ramona L. is married and is 38 years old. She has two children, a girl aged 13 and a boy aged 18 years, both of whom attend school at the Nacional de Zona of the Barrio Unido in the district of Tomas Romero Pereira. Her partner is Mr. Mario Arzamendia Vazque who works in agriculture and cultivates soy beans, sunflowers and cotton and his earnings are contributed to the family finances.

Ramona is the business owner of her grocery store, she also sells livestock (pork), eggs from her own chickens, and she rents out a volley ball court. She can count on her 3 years of experience in the field and she earns a good income.

She is requesting a loan that will be used towards the purchase of merchandise, basic items such as spices, sugar, flower, rice, cooking oil etc. She recommends working with Fundacion Paraguaya for the excellent client services and they have been great help to the small business owners in the region.


Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: flour, cooking oil, and spices.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath P. is a stove maker in the Tie Prampie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, she obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, stove making. She has fully paid back the loan.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sambath P. wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy clay to make more stoves to sell. She would use the rest of the loan to start a firewood selling business to augment her current work.

Her husband, Mr. So Morm, is a taxi driver who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Sambath P. is 45 years old and the mother of a child who is attending school. Mrs. Sambath P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy clay to make more stoves to sell and to start a business selling firewood

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mr. Rin K. lives in Khnach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Oun Yang, is a housewife. They have three children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the others are too young to work or study.

Mr. Rin K. and his family live in poor conditions. He has only one business - construction - and does not earn enough to support his family well. His current house is very old. Therefore, Mr. Rin K. is requesting a loan to build a new house in order to improve his standard of living.

(His wife is on the right of the photo.)

loans.use: To request a loan to build a new house in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab P. is a grocer in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 24-year-old married woman. She has one child who is too young to work or attend school.

Her husband, Mr. Se San, is a construction worker in Thailand.

Since her current business is going well, Mrs. Kolab P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leun

texts.en:
Mrs. Leun N. is a farmer in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she sells coal in the village. Her husband, Mr. Chea Long, helps his wife in the field.

Since Mrs. Leun N.’s coal selling business has improved, she would like to expand it. For this purpose, she is now requesting a loan to buy more coal to resell. She would also like to start a third business. She would like to be a rice middleman where she purchases rice to keep in stock and resells it later at a better price.

In the dry season last year, Mrs. Leun N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer because her field was infertile. She has fully paid it back. Her huband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more coal to resell and to start a second business as a rice middleman (purchasing rice to keep in stock and reselling it later at a better price).

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab L. is a villager in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Vy Penh, is a fisherman.

The couple can generate a small income to support their family. Now Mr. Vy Penh’s business cannot run because his boat is too old. In order to start his business again, Mrs. Kolab L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business.

Mrs. Kolab L. is a 27-year-old married mother. She has one child who is too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Kolab L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem V. is a farmer and grocer in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from these businesses, she is a pig breeder and a rice middleman. She is a hard working woman in the village. Because of her poor conditions, Mrs. Sem V. tries to work with different businesses in order to support herself.

Since her business as a rice middleman is going well, Mrs. Sem V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock and to then resell later at a better price.

She is a 56-year-old widow without any children. Last year, Mrs. Sem V. obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock and to resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat S. is a farmer in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she sells palm wine. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn S., sells lumber in the local village.

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase more lumber. Therefore, his wife, Mrs. Sophat S., decided to ask for a loan for her husband's business. The loan will help him expand his business.

Mrs. Sophat S. is 29 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children attend school while the others are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Sophat S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support her field during the dry season. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more lumber in order to expand her husband's business activities

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im C. is a farmer in Veay Tonsay Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Hen Huy, sells firewood and helps his wife in the field. Mrs. Im C. does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Because her family is too poor, she cannot afford to buy another cow. Therefore, Mrs. Im C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to help the old cow that now plows her rice field.

Mrs. Im C. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Im C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support her field. She has already fully paid back the loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow her field.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton K. is a farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. She cultivates her land twice a year on her plantation. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice. She grows other crops during dry season. Her husband, Mr. Rim Phan, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar. He also breeds pigs. Additionally he helps his wife on the rice field when he has free time.

Mrs. Ton K. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy a new cow to help the old cow that now plows her field. Thus, she has asked for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Ton K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ton K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She fully paid back the loan. Last year, her husband got sick and Mrs. Ton K. had unforeseen expenses to take care of him. This is the reason Mrs. Ton K. does not have enough money to buy a cow to plow her field. Mrs. Ton K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to assist the old cow that now plows her rice field.

loans.name: Thi Thu Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Thu Hang was born in 1974. She wants to borrow 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 246 USD) to invest in her veterinary medicine store. She is now living at Loc Ha hamlet, Mai Lam, Dong Anh province, Hanoi. Her husband is a worker with relatively stabL. income. Mrs. Hang stays at home to manage her store and take care of their children. Her family’s average income is about 2,500,000 VND (equivalent to 152 USD) per month. Her group includes:

Ms. B. Thi Thu, born in 1958, wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 246 USD) to expand her restaurant.

Ms. T. Thi Anh Mai, born in 1969, wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND (equivalent to 120 USD) to invest in her business, which sells machines and equipment.

T. Thi Uyen, born in 1975, wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 246 USD) to sell pigs at the market.

Ms. N. Thi Bich Hanh, born in 1965, wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 246 USD) to do business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Lê Thị Thu Hằng, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 10040030 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để dầu tư kinh doanh hiệu thuốc thú y. Chị hiện đang sống tại thôn Lộc Hà, Mai Lâm, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê có thu nhập ổn định, bản thân chị ở nhà bán thuốc thú y và chăm sóc con cái. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Nhóm vay vốn của chị gồm có: Bùi Thị Thư, sinh năm 1958 (Ms 10040032 ), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để dầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng ăn uống. Trịnh Thị Anh Mai. sinh năm 1969 (Ms 10040045 ), mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để kinh doanh máy móc, thiết bị. Trần Thị Uyên, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 10040033 ), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ bán thịt lợn. Nguyễn Thị Bích Hạnh, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10040031 ), mức vay; 3.604.000 vnđ để kinh doanh.

loans.use: manufacturing

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeurn D. is a farmer in Veal Tonsay Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Sroeurng Kong, makes cabinets and windows to sell. He also helps his wife in the field when he has free time.

On the rice plantation, Mrs. Voeurn D. faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy a cow to assist the old cow that now plows her rice field. For this purpose, Mrs. Voeurn D. has decided to ask for a loan in order to improve her work in the field.

Mrs. Voeurn D. is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help the cow she now has to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov S. is a 38-year-old married father with seven children. One child is employed in a garment factory and five others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Pov S. and his wife are shown in the picture.

Mr. Pov S. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business, he is a teacher who receives $30 per month for his salary. His wife, Mrs. Saroeurn Riel, is a farmer and a grocer in the local village. Since her grocery business is going well, she wants to expand her business. Thus, her husband, Mr. Pov S., has decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods for his wife's inventory.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for his wife's inventory.

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en:
Mr. Pheun M. is a farmer in the Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is a farmer. Aside from this business, he also collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. His wife, Mrs. Khon Huot, helps her husband on the plantation. Mr. Pheun M. is 57 years old and the father of four children. One is a construction worker, and another is a garment factory worker. The others are attending school. Even though the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their standard of living, Mr. Pheun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow cart to move fertilizer to the field to help his farming business. He will use the rest of the loan to buy some piglets for breeding. Previously, Mr. Pheun M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support his field. He has fully paid back the loan.

(His wife is on the left of the photo.)

loans.use: To buy a cow cart to move fertilizer to the field and to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Hong was born in 1966. She wants to borrow 4,876,000 VND to invest in her farm. Currently, her poultry farm has many varieties: 300 ducks, 100 chickens, 100 geese, and other fruit trees such as papaya, and banana trees, etc. Both Hong’s husband and she stay at home and take care of their farm. Their average monthly income is 2,500,000 VND (equivalent to 152 USD). Mrs. Hong always wants to borrow more money to expand her farm structure. In her group, there are four other members: Mrs. L. Thi Mai (born in 1976), Mrs. N. Thi N. (born in 1977), and Mrs. B. Thi Chanh (born in 1982), each of them would like to borrow 4,028,000 VND (equivalent to 245 USD) to expand Mai’s mechanics factory, to invest in N.’s farm, and to invest in breeding animals in Chanh’s case; and Mrs. D. Thi Cai (born in 1975) would like to borrow 2,332,000 VND (equivalent to 142 USD) to sell vegetabL. at the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Lê Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 23070012 ), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chuồng trại. Hiện nay, gia đình chị nuôi rất nhiều gia cầm gồm có: 300 con vịt, 100 con gà, 100 con ngan và trồng nhiều loại cây ăn quả như đu đủ, chuối, ....Vợ chồng chị đều ở nhà tăng gia sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Với mô hình trang trại, gia đình chị luôn mong muốn được vay nhiều tiền để mở rộng chăn nuôi.Trong nhóm vay của chị còn có: Lê Thị Mai, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23070014 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng xưởng cơ khí. Nguyễn Thị Nguyên, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 23070015 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư trang trại. Bùi Thị Chanh, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 23070013 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Đồng Thị Cải, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 23070021 ), mức vay: 2.332.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ buôn bán rau.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom I. is 31 years old. She’s married and has 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Dilorom is an experienced businesswoman. She sells clothing for women and children in the local market. She has been in this business for 5 years. She buys the goods in the neighboring town of Istaravshan. 

Like any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and she dreams that all of them will have a higher education. 

Clothing for women and children are in demand regardless of the season of the year, so Dilorom's business is very stable, generating the primary income and allowing Dilorom to support her large family. 

Now Dilorom needs to increase her working capital so that she is able to purchase the new clothing to sell. For this purpose, she requests $1000 for a term of 12 months. Dilorom thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be as timely and accurate with this loan payment as she was with her previous successful loan.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Thi Dat's Group
loans.use: Buôn bán nhỏ

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
K. Mahbuba is 31 years old. She is married. Together with her husband they are raising four children. Mahbuba sells clothing for women and girls in the central local market. The clothing business that Mahbuba runs brings her immense joy and satisfaction, and fills her with optimism to carry on and try to obtain greater benefits from it.

Mahbuba regularly begins her day at 5 in the morning, when she tends to her four children so that they can go to school and receive an education. After fulfilling her role as a mother, she immediately tends to the sale of her novel clothing garments which, thanks to her efforts and dedication, has generated a good income. The wish of this hard-working mother is to increase the variety of her clothing, especially because September is when her clothing will be in high demand. For this reason she is requesting $850 for the term of 9 months. Mahbuba hopefully waits for your favorable response.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothing for women to sell

loans.name: Thi Xuyen's Group

texts.vi:
Bùi Thị Xuyên, born on 10/07/1956 (Ms 23070030 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into chicken breeding. All her children are grown up and have founded their own family. Her husband stays at home breeding, whiL. she works regularly as a mat maker. The average income of the coupL. is about 2.000.000 vnđ / month. Although she goes to work every day, she still breeds with her husband and is a trustworthy group leader. The other members of the borrowing group are: Nguyễn Thị Đông, born in 1975 (Ms 23070025 ), would like to borrow 4.028.000 vnđ to invest into retailing. Nguyễn Thị Mừng, born in 1956 (Ms 23070029 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into breeding. Lê Thị Tuyên, born in 1960 (Ms 23070027), would like to borrow 4.028.000 vnđ to invest into breeding. Ngô Thị Thanh Hường, born in 1950 ( Ms 23070024 ), would like to borrow 4.452.000 vnđ to invest into breeding.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Bùi Thị Xuyên, sinh ngày 10/07/1956 (Ms 23070030 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Các con cô đã lớn và lập gia đình, chồng cô ở nhà chăn nuôi, bản thân cô đi làm thuê có thu nhậ ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của hai vợ chồng cô khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Mặc dù đi làm nhưng hàng ngày cô vẫn cùng chồng chăn nuôi và là một nhóm trưởng đáng tin cậy. Nhóm vay vốn của cô còn có: Nguyễn Thị Đông, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 23070025 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Nguyễn Thị Mừng, sinh năm 1956 (Ms 23070029 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Lê Thị Tuyên, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 23070027), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi. Ngô Thị Thanh Hường, sinh năm 1950 ( Ms 23070024 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: R. Gulbahor is 28 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband is a teacher and the salary was not enough for living; that’s why Gulbahor decided four years ago to start her own business. Currently she is the main breadwinner in the family. She is sells foods in her grocery store which she rents. She works very hard to give her dear children a good education and to make them happy. Today Gulbahor is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $1000 for the term of 12 months. Gulbahor is counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing her business!

loans.use: Purchasing of foods in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en:
T. Gulhumor is 31 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Both are going to school. Gulhumor’s husband is a financier/banker but currently he’s not working within his specialty. Gulhumor began a business so she could get ahead and cover household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough.

Gulhumor is a market vendor. She is selling housewares in the local markets. Being in this business for several years, Gulhumor knows how to run it properly. The business is stable and generates significant income for the family. 

Gulhumor has been a client of IMON for almost 2 years. She is an accurate client, having a positive history without any delinquency or violations. Today Gulhumor requests $1000 for purchasing housewares in order to enlarge her range of goods. She thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in 12 months promptly.

loans.use: To enlarge the range of housewares

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.en:
K. Bifotima is 52 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. For ten years she has had a business selling fabrics in the market. She travels to the neighboring towns, Istaravshan and Khujand, for purchasing the fabrics. It has now become the main source of income for her family as currently her husband is unemployed. The difficult living conditions forced two of her elder sons to go to Russia for jobs.

Bifotima is a cheerful, hard worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid five loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. She is also raising cattle with the help of her husband. Today Bifotima is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) with the term of 6 months for expanding her business. She is planning to purchase new, modern fabrics and also small cattle. 

Bifotima is counting on your help. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Bifotima’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing of fabric and small cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Mubinakhon

texts.en:
S. Mubinakhon is 54 years old. She is widow and the head of the family with four children who have been the source of her strength to succeed in her business. After the death of her husband, Mubinakhon had to find ways to provide for herself and her four kids. For fifteen years she has had a small business selling the dried apricots. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them by herself. Dried fruits, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides, it is very good for the health.

Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Mubinakhon is quite successful and brings stable income for the family. At the same time, Mubinakhon raises the cattle with the help of her sons. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies, for which with great sacrifice she sends them to a university that they can better their quality of life. 

Today Mubinakhon requests 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 6 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing the apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the range of goods for selling. Also, part of the loan she will spend for purchasing small cattle. 

Mubinakhon expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing of the apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Vahhob

texts.en:
V. Vahhob is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. Vahhob has had a trying life, but he keeps an optimistic outlook on it. He remains a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living. Vahhob is selling the fuel like petrol and diesel fuel near his house. Over 11 years of selling the fuel, Vahhob already has gotten enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Now Vahhob’s children are adults and help their father with the business. In the picture you can see Vahhob’s younger son, as Vahhob was absent at the day of our visit. 

Today Vahhob is requesting a loan of 1000 USD that will be used for increasing his selling goods and meeting his clients' demands. He promises to return this amount in 6 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Vahhob’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling in order to expand the business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 26 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 8 and 3. She became a cow seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan of $175 to increase her stock in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Y. Mukaddas is 61 years old. She is widow and has three children. Mukaddas is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. 

Mukaddas has been running her business already for five years. She is selling fabric for the national dress. Her daughter helps her with the business. The national dress in Tajikistan is very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl. 

Mukaddas has a trading place in the center of the local markets of Isfara City. Being very polite with the clients and having a good taste, Mukaddas has many customers in her trading place. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring city, Istaravshan. Mukaddas is trying to have wide range of goods, able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of the clients with different levels of income. Today Mukaddas requests 3400 Somoni ($1000) to purchase new stock of fabrics for the season. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Your support will really help her. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working!

loans.use: Purchasing of the new fabrics for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
A. Munavvar is 62 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of two adult children. After the death of her husband, Munavvar had to find ways to provide for herself and her two children. Munavvar is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She has always looked for ways to be an important leader by providing extra income to her home. 

Two years ago, she decided to open her own tailoring shop. Munavvar’s tailoring shop specializes in sewing European-style clothing for women, as well as the national style. In addition to sewing, Munavvar is also busy teaching sewing to young girls. Currently, she has four apprentices. 

Today, Munavvar is planning to expand her business and to hire two more seamstresses. She is requests $950 for a term of 9 months. She will use the loan money to purchase new sewing machine produced in Japan. Your support will really help her. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength and is determined to lead a better life!

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines for her expanding business.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky R. is 26 yearsold. She is a married woman with 1 child, age 3. She became a clothes seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Vicky now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asolat

texts.en:
A. Asolat is 49 years old. She is married with two children. 

Asolat has been running her own business for more than ten years. She rents a shop at the center of the town where she sells clothing for women and baby items such as carriages, baby bicycles and different kinds of toys. 

All the goods are delivered by Asolat’s son, who appears in the photo. Asolat and her son are trying to purchase goods of good quality, to sell them for prices acceptable to clients with average levels of income. 

Being a very nice and friendly woman by her nature, Asolat is working hard and trying to serve the clients so that they have a positive experience and want to come back. The business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerably to the family budget. 

Now Asolat is planning to purchase clothing for women in order to increase her range of goods for sale. For this purpose, she requests a loan of $600 for a term of 6 months. She is grateful to everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Sion's Galilaya Group

texts.en:
Sion L. is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 18 and 16. She makes bricks and sells them. This is a business which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sion now hopes for a loan of $450 to buy more materials for making bricks. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Nai F. who has a business dealing with banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more materials for bricks making.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.en:
I. Ismoiljon is 42 years old. He lives in Isfara Town; he is married and has two children. His wife is a nurse. Ismoiljon is selling dried apricots in the central local market. 

Ismoiljon is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. As a rule, he purchases apricots in the market and dries them himself. Because he buys apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Ismoiljon to make his business quite successful, and it brings stable income for the family. 

Today Ismoiljon requests $600 for the term of 6 months. He is going to spend the loan for purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying them in order to increase the range of goods for selling. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Ismoiljon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of the apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Joyce's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 30 yearsold. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 4. She also takes care of 2 other young children. She runs a small shop, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 11am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan of $475 to buy commodities for her business. She will share her loan with another group member, Rosa J..

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
S. Nasiba is 44 years old. Nasiba is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. Nasiba has experience of three years preparing and selling dried apricots. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them with the help of her daughter and son. 

Nasiba always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Nasiba requests $950 for the term of 9 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the range of goods for selling. With your help this will be possible. Nasiba expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni J. is 23 years old. She is a married woman with a one year old child. She runs a small shop which she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

Zaituni now hopes for a loanof $175 to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase  her stock.

loans.name: Salo

texts.en:
S. Salo lives in Isfara Town in the Sugd region of Tajikistan. He is 46 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education and an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. 

Salo buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. 

Salo wants to buy calves and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for a term of 12 months. He wants to earn more income so he can provide his children with a good education and improve their lives. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing of the calves for expanding the business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema E. is 20 years old. She is a married a woman with 3 children. She became a milk and maize seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6.30pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan of $350 to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom U. is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. Islom’s wife is a housekeeper. Islom is working hard because he is the only breadwinner in the family. 

For eight years, he has been selling blankets, towels and children's clothes wholesale. He buys the goods in the neighboring city of Istaravshan and then supplies his customers with the goods in the local market. He tries to choose various goods of fine quality and attractive prices, which allows him to keep his clientele. The business provides a stable income and allows Islom to improve his family's living conditions. Thus, he is accumulating money to arrange the marriage of his eldest son. 

Today, Islom requests $600 to purchase blankets, towels and different kinds of clothes. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 6 months promptly. The progress of Islom’s business is in your hands. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To buy blankets, towels and different kinds of clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
B. Abdugaffor is 54 years old. With his wife they have raised their daughter. Abdugaffor is a farmer. He is a strong physical and spiritual man. Each day he works diligently to make sure that he takes good care of his crop. Abdugaffor sows potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and tomatoes, which he then sells at the local market. Not one minute goes by that he is not attentive to his crop. He plows the land to the best of his abilities. 

Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 30 years and to offer them an education as well. With his job, he has been able to pay for the schooling of his dearest daughter and now he is planning to send her to Turkey for continuation of her education at the university. With this purpose today, Abdugaffor requests 3000 Somoni ($875) for the term of 10 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Abdugaffor thanks everyone who trusted him and is supporting him today, and he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
I. Anvar is 35 years old and is married. He and his wife are raising five children. His wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. Anvar is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a young boy. 

He has 8 years of experience, and he has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. He produces potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, cabbage and other vegetables. Each year, his yield is sufficient for his family's consumption and for selling. 

His business is his family's main source of income, and generating a stable income requires considerable funding. He’s asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) for a term of 6 months to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Anvar would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. With your help, he will get ahead. He thanks all supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa G. is 60 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children between ages 20 and 30. She became a millet seller in 1998. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 6.30pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Rosa hopes for a loan to buy more millet for her business.

loans.use: To buy more millet to increase her stock.

loans.name: Martha's Mercy Group

texts.en:
Martha C. is 25 years old. She is a married woman with one child, age 3 . She became a tailor in 2004. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Martha hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Tasimbora M., who has business dealing with maize sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Muhammadkul

texts.en:
K. Muhammadkul is 34 years old. He’s married and the father of 5 children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus Muhammadkul’s business is the main source of income. 

Muhammadkul is working hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. His business includes growing and selling of agricultural products such as: tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, pumpkins, and cabbage. He has worked in agriculture for six years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. In the sowing season, Muhammadkul plans to sow onion, potato, pumpkin and cabbage. That is why he wants to buy the mineral fertilizer and seeds for what he needs the loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) with the term of 6 months. After gathering his yield, Muhammadkul wants to sell it to locals, with the lowest prices than in the market. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Agnes's Utii Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old, married and has two children ages 13 and 10. She went into business selling maize and beans in 2003. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Agnes is seeking a loan to buy more maize and beans for her business. She will share this loan with the other member of her group, who runs a small general store.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Mrs. Puth C. is a 34-year-old married mother with five children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are attending school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.  Her husband, Mr. Ra Thoem, is a firewood seller who can generate a small income to support her family.   Mrs. Puth C. is a basket maker in Sre Ouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is going well, she would like to expand it.  She asks for a loan to buy more bamboo to make more baskets to sell and for medecine for one of her children who has hepatitis.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo for making baskets and for medicine for one of her children, who has hepatitis.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old, married and has two children ages 6 and 3. She went into business as a fruit seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60.

Grace is seeking a loan to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha K. is a fish seller in Preak Konlong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Teav, is a teacher who receives only a small salary to support his family. They have five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Their neighbor wants to sell a piece of land at a reasonable price so Mrs. Chantha Coub and her husband want to buy it in order to resell later at a better price. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money so Mrs. Chantha Coub requests a loan for this purpose. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Suzana's Ailanga Group

texts.en:
Suzana is 60 years old, married and has three children aged 30, 28 and 25. She became a banana seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 8.30 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Suzana is seeking a loan to buy more bananas to sell. She will share this loan with the other member of her group, who also makes a living selling bananas.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kimsran

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsran D. is 32 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in school.   Mrs. Kimsran D. sells fish in Preak Konlong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sophea Koub, is a farmer. Mrs. Kimsran D. buys fish and resells them but now wants her husband to catch the fish. She requests a loan to buy a new boat to start his business. Mrs. Kimsran D. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new boat.

loans.name: Praing

texts.en: Mrs. Praing N. is a villager in Preak Konlong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells rice soup and her husband, Mr. Hak Ngin, is a farmer. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school. Mr. Hak Ngin does not have an easy way to water his crop so Mrs. Praing N. requests a loan to buy a water pump to water the crop. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Eliadesia

texts.en:
Eliadesia is 37 years old, single and has four children ages 20, 15, 10 and 6. She went into business selling tomatoes in 2006. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to noon and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Eliadesia is seeking a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is 35 years old and the mother o five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.  Mrs. Him S. sells rice soup as a breakfast food in Kampong Os Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she is a teacher receives only a small salary per month. Her husband, Mr. Siyath Men, is a village chief and he also is a fish farmer. His breeding fish business is going well, so Mrs. Him S. requests a loan to buy more fish for breeding and more fish food.

loans.use: To buy more fish for breeding and more fish food.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mr. Chantha R. is a villager in Khnach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a firewood seller and his wife, Mrs. Ny Tol, is a housewife. They have one child who is too young too work or study. They live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mr. Chantha R. wants to startbreeding cows so he requests a loan to buy calves to start his new business. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy calves to start his new business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mr. Chan M. is 30 years old and the father of three children one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is on the right of the photo.  His wife, Mrs. Thea Choeurn, sells bamboo in the local village. Mr. Chan M. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Tie Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His motorbike is too old and always needs to be repaired. To improve his business, Mr. Chan M. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for the business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for the business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. operates a restaurant. She is a trader as well. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to support Hannah and her child.

Hannah has many customers. She is asking for a loan for more capital so she can expand her restaurant, and so increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her restaurant.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rebeca's Edeni Group

texts.en:
Rebeca is 30 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 4. She owns a small general store, which she opened in 2005. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m and can earn a monthly profit of about $50.

Rebeca has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She will share this loan with the other member of her group, who runs a small business selling bananas.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of items she has to sell from her store.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 33-year-old widow who has three children ages 17, 16 and 10. In 2006, she went into business selling clothing. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70.

Deborah has applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. buys fish in large quantities, and then sells the fish in smaller and affordable quantities to her costumers. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. But his income is not sufficient for Mary and her 2 children.

Mary has many customers. She is asking for a loan for additional capital so she can purchase more fish to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase her profits.
