Segundina's dream is to improve her business, to supply more products, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, oil, eggs and candies

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra is a widow, and she started her business to stay active. She started a notions store to help herself economically since her pension is minimal. She started 5 years ago selling notions such as ribbons, buttons, needles, etc, and little by little she started selling other products, mainly those for babies, which is what she does currently.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. With your support, Petra will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Petra es viuda e inició el negocio para mantenerse activa, instalo una mercería para ayudarse económicamente ya que mi pensión es mínima. Comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo productos de mercería como listones, botones, ahujas etc. y poco a poco fue vendiendo otros productos principalmente para bebe y es a lo que se dedica actualmente.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo Petra saldrá delante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina started her business to help herself economically. She started one year ago selling natural products and participating in promotional and sales meetings, through which she started to earn commissions. which have let her improve her quality of life.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to organize meetings that will let her increase her sales to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Catalina inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente. Comenzó hace 1 año vendiendo l productos naturistas y participando en reuniones de promoción y venta del producto, con las cuales empezó a ganar comisiones, que le han permitido mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar el mercancía y organizar reuniones lo que le permitirá subir sus ventas para obtener mas ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
Perfecto set up his business in order to increase his income, as his pension is very small and hardly covers his basic outgoings. He started five months aho selling watches to people he knew and also in other areas as he needs the capital to manage his stock.

He needs a loan of US $275 which he will pay back in 6 months in order to buy watches in cash and have more variety to offer his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Perfecto inicio el negocio para obtener mas ingresos por que su pensión es muy baja y muy apenas le alcanza para cubrir los gastos mas necesarios. Comenzó hace 5 meses vendiendo relojes a sus conocidos y ha funcionado las ventas con apartados por lo que requiero de un capital para manejar más inventario.

El necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar relojes de contado y tener más opciones para sus clientes en cuanto a variedad.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih, 20 years old and single, lives in a poor neighborhood of Beirut, Lebanon.

He works in a small pastry shop in order to finance his university studies. The financial situation of his parents does not allow to Rabih to depend on them. Therefore, he needs an amount of USD 1,000 to complete the payment of his university tuition fees.

This loan will allow him to register for the next university year. This is the first time Rabih has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Payment of university tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo set up her business to generate income and to become active, as she was out of work. And so, she started selling kitchen utensils to support herself. It's not a lot but it is enough to see her through. She started 2 years ago at the recommendation of a friend and as a result, she has been selling these products, normally in street markets, to people she knows and relatives.

She needs a loan of US $275 which she will repay in 6 months, to buy sets of kitchen knives, in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Consuelo inició el negocio para obtener ingresos y tener una actividad productiva, ya que se había quedado sin trabajo entonces le ofrecieron vender utensilios de cocina lo cual le ha dado resultado para obtener recursos no es mucho pero si para sostenerse. Comenzó hace 2 años por invitacion de un conocido y gracias a eso le han gustado las ventas de estos productos y vender en los tianguis a sus conocidos y familiares.

Elle necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar juegos de cuchillos de cocina para levantar sus ventas.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 53-year-old divorced mother of three children. She lives in a very poor neighborhood of Beirut.

She works in the clothes dry-cleaning business. She works for very long hours per day in order to guarantee her three girls a better life.

As the income she generates from her business is not sufficient to improve the livelihood of her family, Nadia also works as a salesperson.

Nadia is requesting USD 1,200 to expand her laundry business by replacing some of the fixed assets. Nadia has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years, and she always has repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: To replace fixed assets in her dry-cleaning business

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora Luz started her business because her husband works in the United States, and she had needs she needed to cover and didn't always have the money to do it. This is why she started selling shoes by catalog to obtain income to support her family and to help her husband with their home's expenses.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase women's shoes and to have meetings to sell and to pick up more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Dora Luz inició el negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos y ella tenia necesidades que tenia que cubrir y no siempre tenia el dinero para hacerlo, por eso empezó con las ventas de zapatos por catalogo para obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para compra zapato para dama y hacer reuniones para vender y levantar mas pedidos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chafik

texts.en:
Chafik, a 38-year-old married man with no children, lives in Beirut.

For a living, Chafik sells women's shoes. He works continually to expand his small business.

This is the second time he has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. After benefiting from the first loan last year, Chafik observed substantiA. revenue increases.

This time, he needs a loan for USD 1,000 as working capitA. to purchase shoe inventory, maintain his business and therefore ensure a better livelihood for his spouse and parents.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 30 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in a poor neighborhood of Beirut.

Ahmad works simultaneously as a waiter and deliveryman in a restaurant. He is a dedicated man who works between 12 and 16 hours per day to improve his family’s difficult condition in life.

Ahmad is requesting USD 1,000 to purchase a better motorcycle for the food deliveries. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle for the delivery work

loans.name: Leslie Elizabeth

texts.es:
Leslie set up her business in order to generate an income which could support her economically, as since she ended her professional career she has been unable to find a good job... It all started in January 2006 when she left her job and moved from another city, with the sale she fitted out the yard and started her business, a store which is small but thriving as it is on the corner and on the way to the local school, meaning that all the children pass by.

She needs a loan of US $325 which she will repay in 3 months, in order to buy groceris and have a better range of products to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Leslie inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso que le permita sostenerse económicamente ya que desde que termino su carrera profesional no ha podido encontrar un buen trabajo.. Comenzó en enero de 2006 cuando dejó de trabajar y recién había llegado de otra ciudad, con la liquidación que le dieron acondicionó el patio de su casa y ahí puso su negocio, una miscelánea muy pequeña pero aprovechando que esta en esquina y es el paso de los niños hacia una escuela cercana, aprovecho la oportunidad para instalar su negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mas abarrotes y tener un mejor surtido para atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 23 years old and single, lives in Beirut.

Mohamad works for an electronic equipment company. He works on packaging and delivery of the machines to the company clients.

He is requesting a loan for USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorcycle that will be more efficient for delivering the packages. This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorcycle for Mohamad's delivery work

loans.name: Sandra Gloria

texts.es:
Sandra started her business selling cosmetics and natural products but she realized that it wasn’t going well, so she convinced her two oldest children to start their own business, taking advantage of the fact that they had studied computers. She began in March 2003 and air-conditioned one of the rooms in her home in order to make it into a computer maintenance workshop, making use of one of her children’s degree in computers. Thanks to God since then it has gone well, and at this pace they will soon have their own shop established.

She needs a loan of $325, which she will repay over 3 months, in order to buy an extensive variety of computer supplies that will help them to perform their work better and satisfy their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra inició el negocio vendiendo cosméticos y productos naturistas pero veía que no le iba bien y fue entonces cuando convencío a sus dos hijos mayores de poner su propio negocio aprovechando que ellos estudiaron informática. Comenzó en Marzo del 2003, acondicionaron uno de los cuartos de su casa para poner el taller de mantenimiento de computadoras aprovechando que uno de sus hijos había terminado la carrera de Lic. En Informática y gracias a Dios desde entonces les ha ido muy bien, a tal grado que ya muy pronto tendran su propio local establecido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un extenso surtido de consumibles de computadoras que les ayudan a elaborar mejor su trabajo y dejar satisfechos a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mourchida

texts.en:
Mourchida is a 50-year-old, married woman who has one child. She lives in a neighborhood of Beirut.

She works as a seamstress in order to help her husband sustain the financiA. needs of their family. Mourchida is very hardworking and very determined to make a difference in her family's condition in life.

This is the second time Mourchida has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs a loan for USD 1,200 to purchase a new sewing machine. She promises to repay her loan ahead of time each month.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, 41 years old and single, lives in a crowded neighborhood of Beirut.

This ambitious and hard-working man works in three different places: as a waiter in a restaurant close to his home, as maitre d' at night in a hotel of Beirut and, finally, he helps his brother with his small “Manakiche” bakery. The "manakiche" is a famous pizza bread that Lebanese usually eat for breakfast.

Abbas needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,000 to purchase a new bakery oven and expand the "Manakiche" family business. The income increase will help improve the livelihood of his brother's family. This is the first time Abbas has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a new bakery oven

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda began her business to help her partner economically with the costs of the family. Her children are small and they do not have enough money for the most basic expenses. She began her salon several years ago. At first she just did haircuts and styling but little by little it has grown and her clientele has increased.

She needs a loan of $675 for work supplies that she will repay in 6 months. With your help, she will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Hila inició el negocio para apoyar economicamente a su pareja con los gastos de la familia.ya que sus hijos estaban pequeños y no completaban con el dinero para los gastos mas necesarios. Comenzó con su estetica hace varios años, primero hacia solo cortes y peinados pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ha logrado incrementar su clientela.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo. con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy work material

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal, 25 years old, is a single student who lives in Beirut, Lebanon.

Nidal is a motivated young man who works in a sporting club in order to pay his university tuition. He is requesting an amount of USD 1,000 to continue paying the total amount of his university fees for next year.

This is the first time that Nidal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Payment of university tuition fees

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives in Beirut.

Yasser is a hardworking and ambitious seamstress. She is requesting a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to purchase fabric and accessories.

This will allow her to continue to provide needed income for her husband and children. Yasser has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past eight years, a sufficient period of time to build solid trust and confidence.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and accessories

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia arriaved to Reynosa three years ago. Her first job was helping her brother with his taco stand in the afternoon.

Time passed and she decided to begin her own business. She began selling articles for school from her home. This generated good income and with that she grew her business. Now she has a store outside of her home with a better selection for her clients. She increased her merchandise little by little in order to have a general store. With the income she makes, she has a good selection.

Now she needs a loan of $625 for 6 months to buy merchandise and paper products for the start of the school year. She has hopes that with Kiva's help she will obtain this.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rosa Idalia llego a Reynosa hace ya 3 años, su primer trabajo fue ayudándole a su hermano atendiendo una taqueria por las tardes. Con el paso del tiempo ella decidió poner su propio negocio, inicio en su casa vendiendo artículos para la escuela, esto le generaba buenos ingresos y conforme a ellos se ha ido ampliando, ahora ya tiene un local afuera de su casa el cual lo tiene ya mas surtido con todo lo necesario para sus clientes. Y poco a poco fue surtiendo de mercancía, para tener una tienda de abarrotes, que con las ganancias que percibe pues la tiene bien surtida.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por US $625 a 6 meses, para comprar mercancía, comprar de artículos para la papelería para este regreso a clases, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia began her own business to help with the family expenses because her husband's salary was not enough to satisfy all their needs.

She first began by selling soft drinks and pork rinds. With this income she was able to cover the economic expenses of the home.

Little by little she increased her merchandies and began to get clients until she was able to establish a better general store.

She needs a loan for $425 that she will repay within six months to buy merchandise. She is confident that with Kiva's help she will get the help that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Elia inicio su propio negocio para ayudar en los gastos familiares de su hogar, por que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para satisfacer todas las necesidades. Primero empezó con la venta de refrescos y chicharrones con las ganancias que esto le fue dejando, pudo ir solventando los gastos económicos en su hogar. Poco a poco fue surtiendo mercancía y se empezó a hacerse de clientes, hasta que logro establecer mejor su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancía, ella confía que con el apoyo Kiva obtendrá la ayuda que necesita.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is 47 years old. She is a single woman and lives in the North of Lebanon. She is a seamstress.

Samira is a very hardworking person. She is determined to earn good money from her traditional sewing business. Samira needs a loan of $200 so she can purchase more wool threads. This will allow her to expand her business.

This is the first time Samira has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She is committed to repaying her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase wool threads

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 61 years old. She is a single woman with no children. She lives in the North of Lebanon.

Hana, whose name means tranquility, is indeed a calm and peaceful woman. She is a seamstress. She needs a loan of $200 to purchase wool threads for her business.

This is the first time Hana is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. She is committed to reimburse her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase wool threads

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer, 33 years old, is married with 5 children. He lives in the North of Lebanon.

Amer owns a shop where he sells vegetables, fruit juices and cocktails. He needs a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more fruit and other merchandise for his shop. With the beginning of the summer season, there is an increased demand for fresh juices. This inventory increase will allow Amer to expand his business by attracting more clients. Therefore, it will help to ensure a better livelihood for his family.

This is the first time Amer has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase an inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 22 years old, is a single man. He lives in the north of Lebanon.

Mohamed owns a small shop, which is next to his home. At the shop he sells and repairs cell phones. He needs a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more goods for his shop.

Mohamed is very ambitious and motivated. His priority in life is increasing his income to ensure a successful future. He wants to get married and raise a family.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase cellphones

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 36 years old, is single. He lives in the north of Lebanon.

Mohamed owns a café in the same area where he lives. He needs a loan of $1,000 so he can purchase more goods for his coffee shop. This includes increasing his inventory of soft drinks, juices, coffee, tea, biscuits and "narguileh" equipment (hubble bubbles). With the summer season, a lot of clients from the neighboring villages come to Mohamed's café in the afternoon and at night, so he needs to expand his products.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase inventory: soft drinks, bottles of juice, coffee, tea, biscuits and "narguileh" equipment (hubble bubbles)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami, 27 years old, is a single man. He lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Rami owns a grocery store. He needs a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more merchandise and diversify his inventory of goods. Indeed, at the time of this interview, Rami’s shop could not answer the demand of all his clients; they want more choice and brands than he carries.

This is the first time Rami has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Working capital to diversify his grocery store inventory

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia, 57 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

To earn a better livelihood, Alia and her daughter started a business in their home. Alia is a seamstress and her daughter is a hair designer for women. The two women are very ambitious and motivated. They requested a loan of $1,200. This loan will let them buy an overlook sewing machine and some haidressing equipment. This will allow them to work on their own and thereby increase their income for the benefit of their family.

Alia has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 8 years, a sufficient period of time to build confidence between her and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy an overlook sewing machine and some hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana, 30 years old, is single and lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Joumana's enthusiasm and willpower allowed her to defy the community as she opened a shop to sell painting materials, a business traditionally managed by men. She requests a loan of $1,200 so she can purchase more goods to sell. This will allow her to attract more clients by offering them a larger variety of products.

Joumana has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years. She has always repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: To purchase painting goods to sell

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih, 28 years old, is a single man. He lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Nazih owns a small shop where he sells cell phones, accessories and perfumes. He needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase more cellphones, which will allow him to improve and expand his business.

Nazih is a very ambitious man. He is willing to ensure better living conditions for his parents and hopes to earn enough money to get married and raise a family.

This is the first time Nazih has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 19 years old, is single. He lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Despite his young age, Mohamed started his own business in order to help his parents improve the livelihood of the family. Mohamed opened a small kiosk where he sells fresh fruit juices. Now, he needs a loan of $1,000 so he can purchase more raw materials for his stand. He would also like purchase a small refrigerator. With the summer season, there is an increased demand for fresh juices.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. He heard about the institution and microlending through word of mouth.

loans.use: To purchase a small fridge and raw material for his fresh juice kiosk

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Fayssal, 47 years old, is married with 4 children. He lives with his family in the North of Lebanon.

Fayssal needs a loan of $1,200 so he has enough capital to purchase a small van. He has a business selling sweets and he would like to use the van so he can drive from village to village and sell his sweets.

This is the first time Fayssal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. He promises to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase a minivan to distribute sweets

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurn C. is a villager in Prey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a garment factory worker who receives a small salary. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. The family members now live in an old house and poor conditions, so Mrs. Soeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to hire a house worker to build her a new house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire house worker to build her a new house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat P. is a bike and motorbike repairer in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His business is going well, so Mr. Sophat P. wants to expand it. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy more bike and motorbike parts to meet the need of his customers.

His wife, Mrs. Saron Ry, is a farmer. Mr. Sophat P. is 52 years old and the father of five children. One child works on the farm with their mother, and the others are enrolled in school. Last year, one of Mr. Sophat P.'s children had a lung disease and Mr. Sophat P. spent $150 to cure his child. This is why he does not have enough money to purchase some parts to fix the bikes and motorbikes.

loans.use: Buy more bike and motorbike parts to expand his repair business.

loans.name: Silath

texts.en:
Mrs. Silath N. is a basket maker in Taing Bampong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province (pictured with her husband). She also cultivates rice and vegetables on her farm. Mrs. Silath N. now faces a small problem, because she does not have enough animals to plow her field. So she is asking for a loan to buy cows to plow it.

Mrs. N.'s husband, Mr. Veasna Von, is a construction worker and pig breeder. Mrs. Silath N. is 27 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school; the youngest child is too young to work or study.

Previously, Mrs. Silath N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and bamboo for making baskets. She has fully paid it back. Last year, Mrs. Silath N. gave birth to her child, and she spent $150. This is the reason that Mrs. Silath N. does not have enough money to buy cows to plow her field.

loans.use: Buy cows to plow the rice field

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of S. M. and has lived in Borewala for the past 3 years. She owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son, who is 19 years old, works with Warid Telecommunication Company. Razia baji’s husband is also an employee in this company. Her next eldest son, who is 18 years old, wants to start a barber shop. Therefore, she is applying for a loan for her son to buy materials to start this business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy wooden furniture to resell; Salma baji wants a loan to buy more chickens to resell; Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; and Shahida baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables for her vegetable business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida baji is the wife of R. A. and lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. She is the mother of five daughters. Khalida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Her husband has been selling vegetables for the past 3 years. Khalida baji is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Rifat baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools; Musarat baji wants a loan for her scrap business; Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle); and Latifan baji wants a loan to buy corn to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. I. and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past year. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her husband sells cosmetics and has been in this profession for the past 5 years. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do domestic chores. She is applying for a loan to buy more cosmetic materials to expand the business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more member: Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to expand her sound system (decks, CDs) business; and Jamila baji and Salma baji each want a loan to buy a tractor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sreyvy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyvy V. lives in Svay Chhuor Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheang Pong, are grocers (pictured here). In their business, they face some problems because some customers buy on credit. For this reason, Mrs. Sreyvy V. does not have enough money to purchase more groceries and increase her inventory.

She is asking for a loan so she can purchase more groceries. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Mrs. Sreyvy V. is 23 and has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Asrop

texts.id:
Asrop is accustomed to waking up early in the morning to prepare the merchandise for his business, which involves selling packaged rice in the morning market. By 3am Asrop and his wife are busy cooking the rice and various side dishes (meat , fish, vegetables) to take to the morning market. Asrop typically sells the packaged rice in the market at five 5am. After all the merchandise has been sold he returns home, usually by 9am, to help his wife with the small stall she runs out of their home. The customers are fellow salespeople at the market.

Through the DINARI foundation, Asrop has access to a loan that can be used to increase working capital so that he can greatly increase the amount of packaged rice that he can sell. From the proceeds Asrop can finance his child’s high school education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Sudah menjadi kebiasaan Asrop bangun pagi-pagi untuk mempersiapkan barang daganganya yaitu berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pagi. Pukul 3.00 pagi Asrop dan istrinya sudah sibuk mulai memasak nasi dan bermacam lauk untuk dibawa kepasar pagi. Asrop biasa berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pada pukul 5.00 sedang pulang dari jualan setelah barang dagangan sudah habis terjual, biasanya pada pukul 9.00 wita juga sudah ada dirumah untuk membantu kesibukkan istrinya yang mempunyai usaha warung kecil dirumahnya. Pelanggannya adalah sesama teman yang berjualan dipasar. Melalui Yayasan DINARI, Asrop mendapat pinjaman dana yang dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dapat menjual nasi bungkus lebih banyak lagi. Dari hasil keuntungan usahanya Asrop dapat membiayai anaknya yang sudah bersekolah di tingkat SMA.

loans.use: Add to working capital to purchase necessities for the business, including wrapping paper, uncooked rice, meat and vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. is a grocer in Preak Pang Village in Kandal Province. Because her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Srey P. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Morn Nuon, is a house builder. His work generates a small income that supports the family. Mrs. Srey P. is 48 years old and the mother of two children; one is employed in a garment factory, and the other is attending school. Mrs. Srey P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell to her customers to expand the business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom Y. lives in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She sells Chinese noodles to the villagers. Her business is going well, so Mrs. Sarom Y. is asking for a loan to buy more noodles to cook for her customers.

She is a 48-year-old widow with four children; two children are teachers, and the others are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sarom Y. had a loan from Acleda Bank to build a house, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy more noodles to cook for her customers
